decoctius: <entryFree id="n12524" type="main" key="de_cocti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcoctĭus</orth>, v. <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcŏquo</orth> <sense id="n12524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decoctor: <entryFree id="n12525" type="main" key="de_coctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcoctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decoquo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n12525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has squandered his own or another's property, a ruined spendthrift, bankrupt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Catull. 41, 4: pecuniae publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 12, 1, 117 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum suorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 18, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:26:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 26, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decoctum: <entryFree id="n12526" type="main" key="de_coctum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcoctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. decoquo, <sense id="n12526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A. b.</sense></entryFree>
decoctus: <entryFree id="n12527" type="main" key="de_coctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from decoquo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12528" type="hapax" key="de_coctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcoctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decoquo</etym>, <sense id="n12528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boiling down, seething</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae mellis decoctu nitescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 195</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decollatio: <entryFree id="n12529" type="main" key="de_colla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcollātĭo</orth>, <sense id="n12529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beheading</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 17, 3</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">traxhlokopi/a, kefalh=s a)potomh/</foreign>, Vet. Gloss. ( = capitis amputatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 28</bibl>), from</sense></entryFree>
decollo: <entryFree id="n12530" type="main" key="de_collo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-collo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>collum</etym>. * <sense id="n12530.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take off from the neck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex collo deponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 25</bibl></cit>: in tuo collo est: decolles cave, Caecil. ib.—</sense><sense id="n12530.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive, rob of</hi> a thing: quibus fructibus me décolĺavi, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 361</bibl>, P.—</sense><sense id="n12530.2" n="II" level="1"> (lit., to strike off the head; and hence with personal object), <hi rend="ital">to decollate, decapitate, behead</hi> (mostly post-class.): piratas, Fenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 361</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apocol. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apocol. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; Petron. 51, 6; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:178" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 178</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 3, 18, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Matth. 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 19" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 194" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 194</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: miles decollandi artifex, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 9:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 9, 25, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decolo: <entryFree id="n12531" type="main" key="de_co_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cōlo</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype> (<sense id="n12531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">old fut. perf.</hi> decolassit = decolaverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 28</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>colum; lit., to trickle from or through; hence trop.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to come to naught, to fail</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si spes decolabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Gapt. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Casin. 2, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum si alterutrum decolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decolor: <entryFree id="n12532" type="main" key="de_co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (<sense id="n12532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> heterocl. decoloros, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 113), <hi rend="ital">adj., deprived of it's natural color, discolored, defaced, faded</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in post-Aug. prose): decolorem sanguinem omnem exsorbuit, Cic. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> Tusc. 2, 8 (transl. from Sophoc. Trach. 1058: <foreign lang="greek">e)k de\ xlwro\n ai(=ma/ mou *pe/pwken h)/dh</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">Indus,</quote> <trans><tr>swarthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and India,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so heres, (sc. Aethiope genitus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:600" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decolor fuligine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decolor sanguine,</quote> <trans><tr>stained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:410" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 410</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 3, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 851</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 57, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12532.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of abstract subjects: deterior ac decolor aetas (i. e. the brazen and iron age, in comparison with the golden), <hi rend="ital">depraved, degenerate</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 326</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decolorate: <entryFree id="n12533" type="main" key="de_co^lo_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcŏlōrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>decoloro</etym>, <sense id="n12533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">degenerately,<cb n="DECO" />  Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto decoloratius vivat peccatrix anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> de Duab. Anim. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decoloratio: <entryFree id="n12534" type="hapax" key="de_co^lo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcŏlōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decoloro</etym>, <sense id="n12534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a discoloring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam ex aliqua contagione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decoloro: <entryFree id="n12535" type="main" key="de_co^lo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cŏlōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to deprive of its natural color, to discolor, stain, deface, soil</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n12535.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: "<hi rend="ital">decoloratur</hi> id cujus color vitiatur, non mutatur," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:41" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 41</bibl>: quod mare Dauniae Non decoloravere caedes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 1, 35</bibl>: manibus collybo decoloratis, Cassius Parmensis ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem (suppurationes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra et nares (pallor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoloratum corpus mortui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva ex albo decoloratur fitque luteola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoloravit me sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:1:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 1, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12535.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tarnish, corrupt, disgrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">famam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ant. Phil. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decompositus: <entryFree id="n12536" type="main" key="de_compo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcompŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>de-compono</etym>, <sense id="n12536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., formed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">derived from a compound word</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">parasu/ndetos</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 664</bibl> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
deconcilio: <entryFree id="n12537" type="hapax" key="de_conci^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-concĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to deprive of, take away</hi>: nihil deconciliares illi, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=217:28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 217, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decondo: <entryFree id="n12538" type="hapax" key="de_condo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-condo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to secrete</hi> by burying: <cit><quote lang="la">alios in ventrem immensae beluae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decontor: <entryFree id="n12539" type="main" key="de_contor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-contor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cunctor</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n12539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to hesitate, to be at a loss</hi> (perhaps only in Appuleius): <cit><quote lang="la">unde potissimum caperet exordium, decontatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl>, p. 198.</sense></entryFree>
decoquo: <entryFree id="n12540" type="main" key="de_co^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cŏquo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n12540.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To boil away, boil down, diminish by boiling</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12540.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque quo ad tertiam partem decoxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so acetum ad quartas, ad tertias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:34" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 69, § 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dimidiam partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars quarta (argenti) decocta erat,</quote> <trans><tr>had melted away, passed off into dross</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12540.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12540.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc., to diminish, repress, consume, waste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum inde decoquent anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensam sed qui bene decoquat iram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutrop. 2, 349</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">hic campo indulget, hunc alea decoquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:57" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12540.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n12540.5" n="a" level="4"> Of personal subjects, <hi rend="ital">to run through the property</hi> of one's self or others; <hi rend="ital">to become a bankrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenesne memoria, praetextatum te decoxisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui primus hoc cognomen acceperit decoxit creditoribus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12540.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To waste away, become impaired, decline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ipsa jam domino decoxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (annis) inertiā Caesarum (imperium) quasi decoxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, Prooem. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum vectigalia cotidie decoquunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gent. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero non tibi decoquet ornithon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12540.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To boil, cook</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12540.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">axungiam fictili novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyathum aceti in calice novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 25, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentem in vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 77, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapa aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 126</bibl></cit>: olus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 74</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12540.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf. subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12540.10" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcocta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aqua), <hi rend="ital">an icy-cold decoction</hi>, invented by Nero as a drink, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 50</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 39</bibl>. With aqua, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:116" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12540.11" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-coctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a medicinal drink, potion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 20, 23, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:108 al" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 84, § 108 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12540.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> (acc. to coquo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. b.), <hi rend="ital">to ripen, dry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 226</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 34, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12540.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To concoct, fabricate, invent</hi>: consilia nefarii facinoris, Decl. M. Posc. Latr.—</sense><sense id="n12540.14" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: suavitatem habeat orator austeram et solidam, non dulcem et decoctam, <hi rend="ital">a severe and solid, not a luscious and mellow sweetness</hi> (the fig. being taken from wine), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 104</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcoctĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adj. comp.</hi> (cf. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">riper</hi>, of composition; <hi rend="ital">more carefully elaborated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice et haec, si forte aliquid decoctius audis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:125" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decor: <entryFree id="n12541" type="main" key="de^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deceo</etym>, <sense id="n12541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">what is seemly, becoming; comeliness, elegance, grace, beauty, ornament</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> word; in prose perh. not before the Aug. per.; esp. freq. in Quint.; v. decus). </sense><sense id="n12541.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mobilibusque decor naturis dandus et annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 157</bibl></cit>; cf.: suus cuique decor est, Quint. <cb n="DECO" /> 10, 2, 22; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also decor quoque a gestu atque a motu venit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and est et in incessu pars non temnenda decoris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divini signa decoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovibus sua lana decori est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 849</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 29.—In rhetor. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">non decorem compositionis quaerimus, sed facilitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:145" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum fuerit illis viris decoris in rebus atque personis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.—In architecture: <cit><quote lang="la">decor est emendatus operis aspectus probatis rebus compositi cum auctoritate, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">varii scenai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:984" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 984</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12541.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of personal comeliness, <hi rend="ital">charms, beauty</hi> (cf.: decens, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 2): <cit><quote lang="la">fugit retro Levis Juventa et Decor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 488</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 1 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 33, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thren. 1, 6</bibl>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcor</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. decoris.</sense></entryFree>
decoramen: <entryFree id="n12542" type="main" key="de^co^ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŏrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>decoro</etym>, <sense id="n12542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornament, decoration</hi> (in post-Aug. poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">vittaque, majorum decoramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:269" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvii decoramina villae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 320</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decoramentum: <entryFree id="n12543" type="main" key="de^co^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŏrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornament, decoration</hi> (late Lat.): matronalia, Tert. Cult. femin. 12: canteriorum, Arn. adv. gent. 5.</sense></entryFree>
decore: <entryFree id="n12544" type="main" key="de^co_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcōrē</orth>, <sense id="n12544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., suitably, properly; elegantly, beautifully</hi>, etc.; v. decorus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decorio: <entryFree id="n12545" type="main" key="de_co^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cŏrĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n12545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>corium</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of the skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">outer covering; to skin, to peel</hi> (post-class., and very rare): <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amygdala decoriata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decoris: <entryFree id="n12546" type="main" key="de^co^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŏris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŏr</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decus</etym>, <sense id="n12546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornamented, adorned, elegant, beautiful</hi> (only in the follg. passages; hence <case>nom.</case> dub.; cf.: <hi rend="ital">dedecor</hi> and <hi rend="ital">indecoris</hi>): magnam domum decoremque Ditem vexarant, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 699</bibl> P.: equis et armis decoribus cultus, Sall. H. Fragm. ib. (Hist. 3, 14).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŏrĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly, beautifully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impeditos crinium globos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 185, 19 al.</sense></entryFree>
decoro: <entryFree id="n12547" type="main" key="de^co^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>decus</etym>, <sense id="n12547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to decorate, adorn, embellish, grace, beautify</hi> (class, and freq.). </sense><sense id="n12547.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larem corona nostrum decorari volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum ex pecunia sua locis communibus monumentisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 217</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa novo saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissignatorem lictoribus atris,</quote> <trans><tr>surrounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tuos digitos decorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. so without <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescias an te generum beati Phyllidis flavae decorent parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n12547.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to decorate, distinguish, honor</hi>, with <case>abl.</case>: nemo me lacrumis decoret nec funera fletu Faxit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">egregias animas ... decorate supremis Muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem populus R. singularibus honoribus decorasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amplissimis honoribus et praemiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O clementiam admirabilem atque omni laude decorandam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubra deorum pietate, domos suas gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prave factis decorari versibus opto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inani vocis sono decoratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 119</bibl></cit> et saep. —Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (remp.) ipse decorarat atque auxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:265" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 265</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene nummatum decorat Suadela Venusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-cŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., adorned, beautiful</hi>.—In <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: orationes, Boeth. Arist. Elench. Soph. 1, 12, p. 743.</sense></entryFree>
decorosus: <entryFree id="n12548" type="hapax" key="de^co^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decus</etym>, <sense id="n12548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elegant, beautiful</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Tob. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decorticatio: <entryFree id="n12549" type="hapax" key="de_corti^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcortĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decortico</etym>, <sense id="n12549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barking, peeling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decortico: <entryFree id="n12550" type="main" key="de_corti^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cortĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n12550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cortex</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of the bark: to bark, to peel</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 41, 80, § 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decorus: <entryFree id="n12551" type="main" key="de^co_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decor</etym>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">eu)preph/s</foreign>. <sense id="n12551.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Becoming, fitting, seemly, proper, suitable, decorous</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n12551.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVAE QVOIQVE DIVO DECORAE GRATAEQVE SINT HOSTIAE PROVIDENTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color albus praecipue decorus deo est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod virginitati decorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 101</bibl>; cf. ib. § 104, and 11, <pb n="523" /> <cb n="DECR" /> 1, 33 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">decorum erat tum ipsis capessere pugnam ducibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 12</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n12551.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (after the analogy of dignus): <cit><quote lang="la">(facinora puerilia) neque te decora neque tuis virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 24</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 43</bibl>).—* </sense><sense id="n12551.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (after the analogy of aptus, accommodatus, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">nos auri venas invenimus et ad usum aptas et ad ornatum decoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12551.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decorum pro causa ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">decorus est senis sermo, quietus et remissus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox et actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 1, 35</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nisi quod honestum decorumque sit admirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino si quicquam est decorum, nihil est profecto magis, quam aequabilitas universae vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:40 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 40 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actuariis minutis Patras accedere ... non satis visum est decorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; so with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce et decorum est pro patria mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 6</bibl> (opp. turpe); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 309 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12551.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-cōrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in Cic. for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pre/pon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">that which is seemly, suitable; seemliness, fitness, propriety, decorum</hi> (for which Quint. uses decor; cf.: decus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): ut in vita, sic in oratione nihil est difficilius quam quid deceat videre. <foreign lang="greek">*pre/pon</foreign> appellant hoc Graeci: nos dicamus sane <hi rend="ital">decorum;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl>; cf.: id, quod Graece <foreign lang="greek">pre/pon</foreign> dicitur, decorum dici Latine potest, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota pro reditu ejus et alia decora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura tribuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n12551.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., decorated, ornamented, adorned; elegant, fine, beautiful, handsome</hi> (not so in Cic.; but freq. in the poets and historians, esp. in Hor. and Tacit.): delubra deum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 352</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 30, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicationes et alia decora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeae ensesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne clipei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra juventae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 559</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 27 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestra,</quote> <trans><tr>noble, skilful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus Augusti dicendis non defuere decora ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: Zeus decorissimus, Apul. Mag. 4, p. 276, 4.— </sense><sense id="n12551.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">abl., adorned with</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">shining, beautiful with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ductores ostro decori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus fulgente arcu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Carm. Sec. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus aureo cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 2, 19, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medi pharetrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea formāque armisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis decorus etiam Graeca facundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces decorae ab aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>.<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcōrē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n12551.8" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.) <hi rend="ital">Suitably, properly, decorously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea si non decore, at quam minime indecore facere possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 47, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n12551.9" n="2" level="3"> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <hi rend="ital">elegantly, charmingly, beautifully</hi>: formata d. Jovis species, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 20 (cf. above, decora delubra deum).</sense></entryFree>
decotes: <entryFree id="n12552" type="gloss" key="decotes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">decotes</orth>, <itype>togae detritae</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 1</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
decrementum: <entryFree id="n12553" type="main" key="de_cre_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcrēmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>decresco</etym>, <sense id="n12553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diminution, decrease</hi> (post-class. for deminutio): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum atque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 257</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decremo: <entryFree id="n12554" type="main" key="de_cre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-crĕmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to burn up, consume by fire</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decrepitus: <entryFree id="n12555" type="main" key="de_cre^pi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-crĕpĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crepo</etym> (lit., noiseless; applied to old people, who creep about like shadows), <sense id="n12555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very old, decrepit</hi> (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vetulus, decrepitus senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Asin. 5, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 36, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter decrepitos me numera et extrema languentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 26</bibl></cit>: aetas (bestiolae), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
decrescentia: <entryFree id="n12556" type="hapax" key="de_crescenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcrescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decresco</etym>, <sense id="n12556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decreasing, waning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotidiana lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (for which, just before, deminutio).</sense></entryFree>
decresco: <entryFree id="n12557" type="main" key="de_cresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cresco</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n12557.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">to grow less, grow shorter, decrease, wane</hi> (as the moon, bodies of water, the length of the day, etc.): ostreae cum luna <cb n="DECU" /> pariter crescunt pariterque decrescunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescunt loca decrescentibus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 345</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 292</bibl></cit>; and: decrescentia flumina, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">die decrescente (coupled with quo rursus crescente),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 59, 60, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi febris fuit atque decrevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 20</bibl></cit> al.: nocte dieque decretum et auctum, Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 869</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">of the waters of the flood,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12557.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to decrease, become less, diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uncus aratri Ferreus occulte decrescit in arvis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wears away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 315</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 536</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23" default="NO">9, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiratio decrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus matrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:82" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 82</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut corpora quamlibet ardua et excelsa, procerioribus admota decrescant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>seem smaller</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 61, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decrescente reditu (agelli) etiam pretium minuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12557.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the gradual disappearance of places as one removes farther from them, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:308" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 308</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 189</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12557.3" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to pass away by diminution; to vanish, disappear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua decrescunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 740</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decretalis: <entryFree id="n12558" type="main" key="de_cre_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcrētālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decerno</etym>, <sense id="n12558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depending on a decree, decretal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">successio bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decretio: <entryFree id="n12559" type="hapax" key="de_cre_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcrētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. decretum, <sense id="n12559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decision, decree</hi>, Mart. Cap. poët. 1, p. 12.</sense></entryFree>
decretorius: <entryFree id="n12560" type="main" key="de_cre_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcrētōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a decision, decisive</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non accedit ad decretorium stilum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to a definitive sentence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intrepidus horam illam decretoriam (viz., the hour of death) prospice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 102 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 288</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 272</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decretum: <entryFree id="n12561" type="main" key="de_cre_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n12561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decree, ordinance, principle</hi>, etc., v. decerno <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decretus: <entryFree id="n12562" type="main" key="de_cre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcrētus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n12562.0" n="1" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from decerno.—</sense><sense id="n12562.1" n="2" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from decresco.</sense></entryFree>
decrusto: <entryFree id="n12563" type="main" key="de_crusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-crusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to peel off, split off, disintegrate</hi>: cum saxa frigus decrustaret, et aquas in crustam verteret, Ven. Vit. Germ. 77.</sense></entryFree>
decubo: <entryFree id="n12564" type="hapax" key="de_cu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cŭbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to lie away from, out of</hi>, e. g. one's bed: de eo lecto non decubat, Fap. Pictor ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deculco: <entryFree id="n12565" type="main" key="de_culco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-culco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to tread down, trample upon</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bacas in qualo pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspros molares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:362" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 362</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deculpatus: <entryFree id="n12566" type="main" key="de_culpa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-culpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>culpo</etym>, <sense id="n12566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faulty, censurable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decultarunt: <entryFree id="n12567" type="gloss" key="de_culta_runt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcultārunt</orth>, <itype>valde occultarunt</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75, 12</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
decuma: <entryFree id="n12568" type="main" key="de^cu^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. decimus.</entryFree>
decumanus: <entryFree id="n12569" type="main" key="de^cu^ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. decimanus.</entryFree>
decumates: <entryFree id="n12570" type="main" key="de^cu^ma_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decimus</etym>, <sense id="n12570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to tithes, tithe-</hi>: agri, <hi rend="ital">subject to tithes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tribute, tithe-land</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, v. Orell. ad h. 1.</sense></entryFree>
decumbo: <entryFree id="n12571" type="main" key="de_cumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cumbo</orth>, <itype>cŭbŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n12571.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lie down</hi>, sc. in bed or on a couch, <hi rend="ital">to recline at table, to lie ill, be confined by sickness</hi> (good prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:156:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 156, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super lectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aureo lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes me ad cenam vocat. Venio, decumbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of reclining at table (cf. accumbo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia decubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 96:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 96, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">febricitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12571.1" n="II" level="1"> Of a vanquished gladiator, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decuncis: <entryFree id="n12572" type="main" key="de^cuncis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcuncis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decem-uncia</etym>, <sense id="n12572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weight of ten unciae</hi>, Rhem. Fann. de Ponder. 46.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">decunx</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> de Ponder. p. 1348</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
decunctor: <entryFree id="n12573" type="main" key="de_cunctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcunctor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. decontor.</entryFree>
decuplatus: <entryFree id="n12574" type="main" key="de^cu_^pla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcū^plātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decuplus</etym>, <sense id="n12574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tenfold</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 437</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decuplus: <entryFree id="n12575" type="main" key="de^cu^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭplus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decem-plus</etym>, <sense id="n12575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tenfold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decures: <entryFree id="n12576" type="gloss" key="de^cu^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭres</orth>, v. 2. decurio.</entryFree>
decuria: <entryFree id="n12577" type="main" key="de^cu^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decem, after the analogy of centuria, from centum</etym>, <sense id="n12577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division consisting of ten, a company of ten, a tithing: decuria, decade</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">deka/s</foreign> (cf. Eng. dozen). Thus Romulus, acc. to Dion. Hal. 2, 7, p. 82 d, <cb n="DECU" /> formed out of the thirty curiae 300 <foreign lang="greek">deka/das</foreign> (gentes), v. 2. decurio <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> So, too, in agriculture: <cit><quote lang="la">classes etiam non majores quam denum hominum faciundae, quas decurias appellaverunt antiqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 3</bibl>. Of things: pellium tentoriarum, Valerian. ap. Trebell. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12577.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen. (cf. centuria), <hi rend="ital">a division, company, class</hi>, most freq. of the decuriae of the judges (three, till the time of Augustus, who added a fourth, and Caligula a fifth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 37, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3877</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3155</bibl> sq. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">VIATORIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4076</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2204 al.</bibl> Said jocosely of a <hi rend="ital">party</hi> of boon companions, <hi rend="ital">association, club</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 62</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 19</bibl> (Com. 15 Ribb.).</sense></entryFree>
decurialis: <entryFree id="n12578" type="main" key="de^cu^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decuria</etym>, <sense id="n12578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a decuria</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; hence <hi rend="ital">subst., a member of a decuria</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DECVRIALIVM GERVLORVM DISPENSATOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 874</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">976</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2252</bibl>; 3216 al.; Fragm. Vat. § 142.</sense></entryFree>
decuriatim: <entryFree id="n12579" type="gloss" key="de^cu^ri^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.; cf. centuriatim</etym>, <sense id="n12579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by decuriae</hi>, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 165</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
decuriatio: <entryFree id="n12580" type="hapax" key="de^cu^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. decurio</etym>, <sense id="n12580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dividing into decuriae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribulium, descriptio populi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decuriatus: <entryFree id="n12581" type="hapax" key="de^cu^ri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dividing into decuriae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi (milites) ad decuriatum aut centuriatum convenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decurio: <entryFree id="n12582" type="main" key="de^cu^ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>decuria</etym>, <sense id="n12582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide into decuriae.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12582.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">equites decuriati, centuriati pedites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38</bibl></cit>, v. preced. art.—Esp. <hi rend="ital">to divide the people into companies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clubs for purposes of bribery and corruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum delectus habebatur ... cum vicatim homines conscriberentur, decuriarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decuriasse Plancium, conscripsisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 5</bibl>, and v. decuriatio.— * </sense><sense id="n12582.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex incrementis lustralibus decuriatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a man ten lustres old</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, p. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12583" type="main" key="de^cu^ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (also DECURES decuriones, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 22</bibl>, and 75, 9 Müll.; <sense id="n12583.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and DECVRIONVS, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:49:16" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 16</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the head</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chief of a decuria, a decurion</hi>. The name was first given by Romulus to the head of the tenth part of a curia (cf. Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 1, p. 354). In the army, <hi rend="ital">the commander of a</hi> decuria <hi rend="ital">of cavalry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 91</bibl> Müll.; Veget. Mil. 2, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl>. After the extension of the Roman dominion, <hi rend="ital">the members of the senate of the municipia and the colonies were called</hi> decuriones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:239" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2" default="NO">50, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 15, 43</bibl>.—Sometimes i. q. praefectus, applied to the overseer of the persons employed in any duty about the court, e. g. <hi rend="ital">a head-chamberlain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>, PROCVLVS DECVRIO GERMANORVM (i. e. custodum corporis) TI. GERMANICI, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2923</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decurionalis: <entryFree id="n12584" type="gloss" key="de^cu^ri^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. decurio</etym>, <sense id="n12584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a decurion</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">bouleutiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 469, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decurionatus: <entryFree id="n12585" type="main" key="de^cu^ri^o_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office and dignity of a decurion;</hi> of cavalry, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=201:28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 201, 28</bibl> M.; in the municipia, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 2, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 164 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
decurionus: <entryFree id="n12586" type="main" key="de^cu^ri^o_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭrĭōnus</orth>, v. 2. decurio <sense id="n12586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decurro: <entryFree id="n12587" type="main" key="de_curro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-curro</orth>, cŭcurri <sense id="n12587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">or</hi> curri (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decucurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decucurrerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decucurrisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 17</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">decurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurrēre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurrisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 26</bibl></cit>), <itype>cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and (with homogeneous objects, viam, spatium, trop. aetatem, etc.) <hi rend="ital">a., to run down</hi> from a higher point; <hi rend="ital">to flow, move, sail, swim down; to run over, run through, traverse</hi> (class. and very freq.). —</sense><sense id="n12587.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12587.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12587.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tribunali decurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 50</bibl></cit>: Laocoon ardens<pb n="524" /> <cb n="DECU" />  summa decurrit ab arcs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab agro Lanuvino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; for which merely with the <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">altā decurrens arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 490</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jugis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ad cohortandos milites decucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad naves decurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego puto te bellissime cum quaestore Mescinio decursurum (viz., on board ship),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuto mari,</quote> <trans><tr>to sail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeri cymbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus siccis super summa aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis ad hamum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monte decurrens velut amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 569</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti naves decurrerent,</quote> <trans><tr>should sail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insulam quamdam decurrentes,</quote> <trans><tr>sailing to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis Iomanes in Gangen per Palibothros decurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc video calcem, ad quam cum sit decursum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo decursum prope jam siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:962" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 962</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12587.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septingenta milia passuum vis esse decursa biduo?</quote> <trans><tr>run through</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurso spatio ad carceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, with the accessory idea of completion: nec vero velim quasi decurso spatio ad carceres a calce revocari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">decursa novissima meta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 597</bibl></cit>: vada salsa puppi, Catull. 64, 6.—</sense><sense id="n12587.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the stars (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">to accomplish their course</hi>: stellaeque per vacuum solitae noctis decurrere tempus, Lucan. 1, 531; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lampas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 501</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12587.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to go through military exercises</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manœuvres, to advance rapidly, to charge, skirmish</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pedites decurrendo signa sequi et servare ordines docuit,</quote> <trans><tr>while performing evolutions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex montibus in vallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omnibus partibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex superiore loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Capitolio in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde (sc. a Janiculo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibili celeritate ad flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinto (die) iterum in armis de cursum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12587.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to walk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run in armor</hi>, in celebrating some festival (usually in funeral games): <cit><quote lang="la">(in funere Gracchi tradunt) armatum exercitum decucurrisse cum tripudiis Hispanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter circum rogos, cincti fulgentibus armis, decurrēre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl> (v. decursio). —</sense><sense id="n12587.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12587.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12587.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin proclivius hic iras decurrat ad acreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 312</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:706" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 706</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1262" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1262</bibl>: quibus generibus per totas quaestiones decurrimus, <hi rend="ital">go over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 48</bibl>;
