cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium eo sententiae decurrerunt, ut, pax, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>come to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ides se non illuc decurrere, quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Philotam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad consulendum te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 96</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurritur ad leniorem sententiam,</quote> <trans><tr>they come to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo extra calcem decurrens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo eo decursum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:20" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12587.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurso aetatis spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so of one's course of life,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1042" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1042</bibl></cit>: noctis iter, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6, p. 6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, p. 6</bibl> Müll. (v. 347 Ribb.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem (with agere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: tuque ades inceptumque unā decurre laborem (the fig. is that of sailing in a vessel; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">soon after: pelagoque volans da vela patenti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 39</bibl></cit> Heyne: <cit><quote lang="la">ista, quae abs te breviter de arte decursa sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>treated, discussed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 148</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equos pugnasque virum decurrere versu,</quote> <trans><tr>to sing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 5, 3, 149</bibl></cit>: prius ... quam mea tot laudes decurrere carmina possint, Auct. Paneg. in Pis. 198.—</sense><sense id="n12587.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12587.13" n="1" level="3"> Pregn.: ad aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to betake one's self to, have recourse to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec extrema et inimicissima jura tam cupide decurrebas, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad istam hortationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 33, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad oraculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad miseras preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 29, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haemonias ad artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">assuetas ad artes (Circe),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rem. Am. 287</bibl></cit>. Rarely to persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Alexandri exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> <cb n="DECU" /> <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurritur ad illud extremum atque ultimum S. C.... DENT OPERAM CONSVLES, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12587.14" n="2" level="3"> Of the heavenly bodies, <hi rend="ital">to set, move downwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua sol decurrit meridies nuncupatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 505</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc., to traverse</hi>, Tibull. 4, 1, 160.—</sense><sense id="n12587.15" n="3" level="3"> In the rhetor. lang. of Quint., said of speech, <hi rend="ital">to run on</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:55 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 55 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:6" default="NO">11, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:2 al" default="NO">12, 9, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12587.16" n="4" level="3"> Proverb., <hi rend="ital">to run through</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to leave off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae meae decucurrerunt (sc. ex quo podagricus factus sum),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>my former cheerfulness is at an end, is gone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64, 3</bibl></cit>.—So, haec (vitia) aetate sunt decursa, <hi rend="ital">laid aside</hi>, Coel. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decursio: <entryFree id="n12588" type="main" key="de_cursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decurro</etym>, <sense id="n12588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flowing down</hi> (less freq. than decursus; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n12588.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12588.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a manœuvre, military exercise, evolution, a descent, hostile attack</hi>, Brutus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:24:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 24, 3</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 42.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12588.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a walking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">running in complete armor</hi> at a solemnity or for exercise, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decursorius: <entryFree id="n12589" type="main" key="de_curso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcursōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um., <sense id="n12589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., pertaining to the race-course</hi>: termini, Innoc. rei agr. p. 223 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
decursus: <entryFree id="n12590" type="main" key="de_cursus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcursus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from decurro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12591" type="main" key="de_cursus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decurro</etym>, <sense id="n12591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running down, downward course, descent; declivity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n12591.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12591.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">montibus ex altis magnus decursus aquaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:264" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:944" default="NO" valid="yes">944</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 266</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus (amnium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 523</bibl></cit>: navium, Frontin. Strat. 1, 5, 6: planitiei, <hi rend="ital">descent, inclination</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 29; <cit><quote lang="la">hence concr.,</quote> <trans><tr>a descending aqueduct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secus decursus aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12591.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12591.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a manœuvring, evolution, hostile attack</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 55</bibl>; Frontin. Strat. 2, 2, 2 al.—</sense><sense id="n12591.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a running in armor</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">peridromh/</foreign>, on the occasion of a festival, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:61" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:52" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 52</bibl>; cf. decurro and decursio.—</sense><sense id="n12591.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The completion, end of a course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">destitit ante decursum, neque eo secius coronatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12591.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12591.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilior erit mihi quasi decursus mei temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>a course, career</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forensium rerum labor decursu honorum et jam aetatis flexu constitisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after administering every grade of office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12591.9" n="B" level="2"> Rhetor. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the rhythmical movement of a verse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:115" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:25" default="NO">11, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decurtatio: <entryFree id="n12592" type="main" key="de_curta_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcurtātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decurto</etym>, <sense id="n12592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mutilation</hi>: caudae, Mar. Victor. 2511 P.</sense></entryFree>
decurto: <entryFree id="n12593" type="main" key="de_curto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-curto</orth>, no <sense id="n12593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1 (only in the <hi rend="ital">part. praes.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to cut off, curtail, mutilate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12593.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum undique decurtatum, cum aures illi nasumque abscidisset, in cavea diu pavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peniculamenta canteriorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 163</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12593.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style: <hi rend="ital">mutila</hi> sentit quaedam et quasi decurtata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 53, 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decurvatus: <entryFree id="n12594" type="main" key="de_curva_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-curvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., bent, curved back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars aratri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 80, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decus: <entryFree id="n12595" type="main" key="de^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. daças, fame; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">do/ca</foreign>; cf. decet</etym>, any thing that ornaments, embellishes, adorns, honors, etc.; <sense id="n12595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornament, grace, embellishment, splendor, glory, honor, dignity</hi> (class. and freq.; a favorite word with Cicero, in oratorical lang.). </sense><sense id="n12595.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12595.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium spolia, decora atque ornamenta fanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senator populi Romani, splendor ordinis, decus atque ornamentum judiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, decus ornamentumque senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hominis decus ingenium, sic ingenii ipsius lumen est eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 15, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad decus et ad laudem civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem et decus sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">O decus Phoebi et dapibus supremi Grata testudo Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucidum caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Sec. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum Maecenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 3, 16, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 2</bibl> and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 4</bibl>: electos juvenes simul et decus innuptarum, <hi rend="ital">the ornaments</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the most beautiful of the maidens</hi>, Catull. 64, <cb n="DECU" /> 78 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">castique decus servare pudoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>beauty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:422" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus Asteriae = Asteria decens or pulchra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12595.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: haec omnia, quae habent speciem gloriae contemne ...; <cit><quote lang="la">verum decus in virtute positum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae, decus, gloria in oculis sita sunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 58, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 72, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">regale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus enitet ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superimpositum capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(columnas) scenis decora alta futuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebre,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>chastity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immemores decoris liventia pectora tundunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of their bodily charms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatori nobilitas, quae antea decori, invidiae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis ut arboribus decori est, ut vitibus uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pilumno quos ipsa decus dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12595.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12595.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A deed of honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti decoris testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 50</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <number>plur.</number>, decora, <hi rend="ital">honorable achievements, valiant deeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multa referret sua familiaeque decora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae decora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 20, 7</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecora militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 51, 12</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonii vetera, Macedones praesentia decora intuebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12595.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Renowned ancestors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nobiles, et longa decora praeferentes, novitas mea enituit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hist. 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12595.7" n="III" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">moral dignity, virtue, honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quod decus antiqui summum bonum esse dixerunt, hic solum bonum dicat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit> (for which, shortly before, solum bonum esse quod honestum esset): <cit><quote lang="la">quos (sc. Epicureos) nisi redarguimus, omnis virtus, omne decus, omnis vera laus deserenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with honestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ei (sc. Semproniae) cariora semper omnia quam decus atque pudicitia fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes">54, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12596" type="main" key="de^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. decussis, <sense id="n12596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decussatim: <entryFree id="n12597" type="main" key="de^cussa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcussātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>decusso</etym>, <sense id="n12597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a Roman ten</hi> (X), <hi rend="ital">crosswise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 56, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decussatio: <entryFree id="n12598" type="main" key="de^cussa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcussātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intersecting of two lines crosswise, decussation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decussio: <entryFree id="n12599" type="hapax" key="de_cussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decutio</etym>, <sense id="n12599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking off, rejection</hi>, trop.: amputatio et decussio redundantioris nitoris, Tert. Cult. fem. 9.</sense></entryFree>
decussis: <entryFree id="n12600" type="main" key="de^cussis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcussis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">decus</orth>, <itype>i, a mutilated form used by the Agrimensores</itype>, p. 231, 243, and 265, ed. Goes.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decem-as</etym>. <sense id="n12600.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The number ten</hi>: ex singularibus rebus, quae <foreign lang="greek">mona/des</foreign> apud Graecos dicuntur perficitur decussis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl> (cf. the art. as, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.).—Hence, * decussis sexis, or in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcussissexis</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the number sixteen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12600.1" n="B" level="2"> Because the Roman numeral sign for ten was X, decussis was used to denote <hi rend="ital">the intersection of two lines in the form of a cross</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regula figitur in primo decussis puncto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 331</bibl>. Cf. decusso and its derivatives.—</sense><sense id="n12600.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">as, no.</hi> II.) <hi rend="ital">Ten asses;</hi> as a Roman coin, <hi rend="ital">a ten-as piece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=170" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 9:section=81" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 9, § 81</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 4, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=237:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 237, 20</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
decusso: <entryFree id="n12601" type="main" key="de^cusso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcusso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>decussis, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</etym>, <sense id="n12601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide crosswise</hi>, in the form of an X, <hi rend="ital">to decussate</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:6 al" default="NO">4, 17, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
decussus: <entryFree id="n12602" type="main" key="de_cussus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. follg. art.</entryFree>
decutio: <entryFree id="n12603" type="main" key="de_cu^ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>cussi, cussum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quatio</etym>, <sense id="n12603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shake off, strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat off, cast off</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Caes. or Cic.). </sense><sense id="n12603.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">decussa Cydonia ramo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 27: <cit><quote lang="la">lilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:707" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa papaverum capita baculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 131</bibl></cit>: honorem (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for frondem) silvis, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 404</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uncum mento fixum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:141" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 141</bibl></cit> (5, 1, 141 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">Victoria fulmine icta decussaque,</quote> <trans><tr>struck down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnas muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partem muri arietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros ariete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidos avium sagittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 50, § 97</bibl></cit>: collem decusso Labieni praesidio celeriter occupaverunt, <hi rend="ital">dislodged</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decussus Capitolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—In comic lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex armario argenti tantum, quantum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to shake out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12603.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: cetera aetate <pb n="525" /> <cb n="DEDE" /> jam sunt decussa, <hi rend="ital">shaken off, thrown aside</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13, 1</bibl> (al. decursa): <cit><quote lang="la">ad id non accedes, ex quo tibi aliquid decuti doles,</quote> <trans><tr>wrested</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 18</bibl></cit> 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12604" type="main" key="de_cu^ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ire, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>de-cutis</etym>, <sense id="n12604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of skin, to flay</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dedamno: <entryFree id="n12605" type="hapax" key="de_damno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-damno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (to release from condemnation, i. e.), <sense id="n12605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to absolve, acquit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem, sceleris manifestum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedeceo: <entryFree id="n12606" type="main" key="de_de^ceo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĕceo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, v. dedecet, <sense id="n12606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</sense></entryFree>
dedecet: <entryFree id="n12607" type="main" key="de_de^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĕcet</orth>, <itype>cuit, 2</itype>, <sense id="n12607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> (very rarely pers., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II.), <hi rend="ital">it is unseemly, unsuitable, unbecoming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decere quasi aptum esse consentaneumque tempori et personae, etc.... contraque item dedecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12607.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.; usually connected with a negation), construed like decet (q. v.), with <case>nom.</case> or <hi rend="ital">inf. rei</hi>, and with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12607.2" n="a" level="4"> </sense><sense id="n12607.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Neque te ministrum dedecet myrtus neque me sub arta vite bibentem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 38, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me usus precum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rem. Am. 410</bibl></cit>. In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dominam motae dedecuere comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12607.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Ut, si quid dedeceat, vitemus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12607.5" n="b" level="4"> </sense><sense id="n12607.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Oratorem irasci minime decet, simulare non dedecet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 530</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam removeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12607.7" n="(b)" level="5"> (Togae) extremam oram rejecisse non dedecet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 12, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12607.8" n="c" level="4"> Ut iis, quae habent, modice et scienter utantur, et ut ne dedeceat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 132</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12607.9" n="II" level="1"> By <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license <hi rend="ital">person.</hi> as a <hi rend="ital">v. a., to dishonor, neglect</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si non dedecui tua jussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:340" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticus Claudiorum imagines dedecere videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedecor: <entryFree id="n12608" type="main" key="de_de^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĕcor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <sense id="n12608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., unseemly, unbecoming, shameful, vile</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dedecorem amplexi vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:760" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecores inultique caedebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. 3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. 3, 91</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 699</bibl> P.).</sense></entryFree>
dedecoramentum: <entryFree id="n12609" type="hapax" key="de_de^co^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĕcŏrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dedecoro</etym>, <sense id="n12609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgrace, dishonor</hi>, Gracch. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 21, 4</bibl> (with inhonestamentum and flagitium).</sense></entryFree>
dedecoratio: <entryFree id="n12610" type="main" key="de_de^co^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĕcŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgrace, dishonor</hi> (late Lat.), Tert. Cor. mil. 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dedecorator: <entryFree id="n12611" type="main" key="de_de^co^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĕcŏrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who dishonors; a reviler, blasphemer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedecoro: <entryFree id="n12612" type="main" key="de_de^co^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĕcŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to disgrace, dishonor, bring to shame</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mores, quibus boni se dedecorant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me flagitiis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se flagitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 42</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et urbis auctoritatem et magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 36; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 4, 36</bibl> (where others read indecorant).</sense></entryFree>
dedecorosus: <entryFree id="n12613" type="main" key="de_de^co^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĕcŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., disgraceful, dishonorable</hi> (post-Aug., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 39</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jes. 16, 58, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĕcŏ-rōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">disgracefully</hi>: vixi, turpius peream, Nero ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 5" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dedecorus: <entryFree id="n12614" type="main" key="de_de^co_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĕcōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., disgraceful, dishonorable, shameful</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majoribus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dedecus: <entryFree id="n12615" type="main" key="de_de^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĕcus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n12615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgrace, dishonor, infamy, shame</hi> (for syn. cf.: offensio, contumelia, infamia, ignominia, turpitudo, obscoenitas, injuria—freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12615.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: eos dolores atque carnificinas per dedecus atque maximam contumeliam te facere ausum esse? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with ignominia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with infamia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cluent. 22, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with flagitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with probrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam per dedecus amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dedecora incurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with damnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum fuit generi vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecori est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecori esse (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: aliter ampla domus dedecori domino fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12615.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr. (as sometimes our word <hi rend="ital">shame</hi>), <hi rend="ital">that which causes shame; a disgrace, blot, blemish</hi>: cum nec prodere visum dedecus auderet (viz., the ass's <cb n="DEDI" /> ears of Midas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 184</bibl>; cf.: naturae dedecus, <hi rend="ital">a monster</hi>, said of the ass, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 3, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12615.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to decus, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.) Like <foreign lang="greek">to\ kako/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">moral dishonor, vice, turpitude; a vicious action, shameful deed</hi>, etc. (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">decus, quod antiqui summum bonum esse dixerant ... itemque dedecus illi summum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad avertendos tantorum dedecorum rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl></cit> et saep.; of <hi rend="ital">unchastity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 473</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecorum pretiosus emptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abdicamus occulta dedecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedicatio: <entryFree id="n12616" type="main" key="de_di^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dedico</etym>, <sense id="n12616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dedication, consecration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Esdr. 6, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 3, 2 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dedicativus: <entryFree id="n12617" type="main" key="de_di^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dedico</etym> in the later philosoph. lang. = affirmativus, <sense id="n12617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">affirmative</hi> (opp. abdicativus): <cit><quote lang="la">propositio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 31, 23 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭcātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">affirmatively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concludere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 409</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedicator: <entryFree id="n12618" type="main" key="de_di^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who dedicates;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a founder, author</hi> (eccles. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">damnationis nostrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Car. Christ. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dedico: <entryFree id="n12619" type="main" key="de_di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (in the <sense id="n12619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tmesis</hi>: data deque dicata, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 287, 28</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to give out tidings, a notice</hi>, etc.; hence, <hi rend="ital">to affirm, declare, announce</hi> any thing (cf. de in denuncio and depromo). </sense><sense id="n12619.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so only ante- and postclass.): legati quo missi sunt, veniunt, dedicant mandata, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 280, 7</bibl>; Att. ib. (v. 78 Ribbeck); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 422</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 208</bibl>: aliae (propositiones) dedicativae sunt, quod dedicant aliquid de quopiam; ut: <hi rend="ital">Virtus bonum est</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedicat enim virtuti inesse bonitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>affirms</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 30 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. dedicativus.—</sense><sense id="n12619.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n12619.3" n="A" level="2"> Relig. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to dedicate, consecrate, set apart</hi> a thing to a deity or deified person (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">1. dico, consecro, inauguro, initio.—Class.): nonne ab A. Postumio aedem Castori ac Polluci in foro dedicatam vides?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Saturno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Mercurii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">delubrum Homeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca sacris faciendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram Augusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 8, 63</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n12619.4" n="b" level="4"> With the deity as object instead of the temple: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Fides, ut Mens, quas in Capitolio dedicatas videmus (i. e. quarum aedes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 79</bibl> (cf. however, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Junonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and even te quoque magnificā, Concordia, dedicat aede, Livia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:637" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 637</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12619.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-Aug.) </sense><sense id="n12619.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To dedicate, inscribe</hi> a composition to any one (for which mittere ad aliquem, or mittere alicui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Honori et meritis dedicans illum librum tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit> prol. 30; <cit><quote lang="la">Plin. H. N. praef. § 12: perfecto operis tibi dedicati tertio libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit> prooem. § 1.—</sense><sense id="n12619.7" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to destine, dispose, prepare, set up</hi> a thing for any purpose; <hi rend="ital">to dedicate, consecrate</hi> it to any object: <cit><quote lang="la">equi (sc. Bucephalae) memoriae ac nomini dedicans urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui proprie libros huic operi dedicaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:50" default="NO">12, 10, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasii tabulam ... in cubiculo dedicavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>to establish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 9, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12619.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To dedicate, consecrate, devote</hi> a thing to its future use: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphitheatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thermas atque gymnasium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12619.9" n="B" level="2"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to specify one's property in the census</hi> (rare): tu in uno scorto majorem pecuniam absumsisti, quam quanti omne instrumentum fundi Sabini in censum dedicavisti, P. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at haec praedia in censu (al. censum) dedicavisti? ... Illud quaero sintne ista praedia censui censendo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,017:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Flac. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes in censu villas inde dedicamus aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=160" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 160</bibl></cit> Müll. (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
dedignatio: <entryFree id="n12620" type="main" key="de_digna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdignātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dedignor</etym>, <sense id="n12620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disdaining,<cb n="DEDO" />  refusal</hi> (post-Aug., and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tacita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:18:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedigno: <entryFree id="n12621" type="main" key="de_digno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-digno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, collat. form of dedignor: <sense id="n12621.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">tumulos aut ossibus urnas dedignant animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Carm. 9, 28</bibl></cit> (Duhn).</sense></entryFree>
dedignor: <entryFree id="n12622" type="main" key="de_dignor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dignor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. dep., to reject as unworthy, to disdain, scorn, refuse</hi> (most freq. in Ov.; perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n12622.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: quos ego sim toties jam dedignata maritos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 536</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem maritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum, Pelasgum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitem amicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 1, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippum patrem ( = abdicare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dedignanda carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:538" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 538</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12622.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni genibus procumbere non est Dedignata Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 586</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 2, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12622.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">accendebat dedignantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedisco: <entryFree id="n12623" type="main" key="de_disco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-disco</orth>, <itype>dĭdĭci, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to unlearn, to forget</hi>, sc. what one has learned (rare, but class.). </sense><sense id="n12623.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, quod didicit, id dediscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa oportet discat atque dediscat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">haec verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:171" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 46, 171</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 93</bibl>: nomen disciplinamque populi Romani, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordaque languentem dedidicere metum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Praef. Rapt. Pros. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: dedidicit jam pace ducem, <hi rend="ital">has unlearned the general</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lost his military character</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedisce captam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 887" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 887</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dediscit animus sero quod didicit diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 631" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 631</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12623.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eloquentia) loqui dedisceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 297 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dediticius: <entryFree id="n12624" type="main" key="de_di^ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭtīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deditio</etym>, <sense id="n12624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a surrender</hi> or <hi rend="ital">capitulation;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dediticius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has surrendered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">capitulated, a captive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid deinde patiemur, dediticii vestri passuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 4, 49</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38 al.</bibl>—According to a decree of the Lex Aelia Sentia (A. U. C. 757), slaves who had suffered an infamous punishment were to be by manumission only dediticiorum numero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 13</bibl> and 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 3</bibl>; Sanders ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
deditim: <entryFree id="n12625" type="gloss" key="de_di^tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭtim</orth>, <sense id="n12625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., by surrender;</hi> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 402</bibl> P. [dedo].</sense></entryFree>
deditio: <entryFree id="n12626" type="main" key="de_di^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dedo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n12626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (military) <hi rend="ital">giving up, a surrender, capitulation</hi> (freq. in the historians).—With <hi rend="ital">subj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditio sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditiones cohortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 70</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 6</bibl>; but usually <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii legatos de deditione ad eum miserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de deditione agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in deditionem petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 23:7" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in deditionem accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:B. G. 1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO">2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">seque in deditionem ut recipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in deditionem redigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:25" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionis condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditione facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subire deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 81, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in deditionem venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to surrender</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 99, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:33" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omissa deditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 70:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 70, 1</bibl> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">deditio ad tam infestos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum locum tibi reliquum non modo ad pacem, sed ne ad deditionem quidem feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 21, 48</bibl></cit> et saep. An unusual combination is <hi rend="ital">deditionem</hi> suam ad aliquem absentem <hi rend="ital">mittere</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:7:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 7, 5</bibl>; v. Graev. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
deditus: <entryFree id="n12627" type="main" key="de_di^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>dedo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
dedo: <entryFree id="n12628" type="main" key="de_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-do</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum</itype> (<sense id="n12628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">infin. pass. parag.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit., <hi rend="ital">to give away, give up</hi> from one's self; hence, with respect to the term. ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi> any thing to one, <hi rend="ital">to surrender, deliver, consign, yield</hi> (stronger than do, q. v.—freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12628.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12628.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in pistrinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Andr. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem hostibus in cruciatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which neci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:840" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 840</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem istis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi iratae infamem juvencum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 27</bibl></cit>, <pb n="526" /> <cb n="DEDO" /> 46: <cit><quote lang="la">Assyrios cineri odores,</quote> <trans><tr>impart, devote</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12628.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to deliver up, surrender</hi> some one or something to the enemy; and with se, <hi rend="ital">to surrender one's self, capitulate</hi>: INIVSTE IMPIEQVE ILLOS HOMINES ILLASQVE RES DEDIER, an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem, agrum, aras, focos seque uti dederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos, qui sibi Galliaeque bellum intulisset, sibi dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">auctores belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cirtam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ambiani se suaque omnia sine mora dediderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suaque omnia Caesari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">se in ditionem atque in arbitratum Thebano poplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumitatem deditis pollicebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16 al.</bibl>: se, without <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 8</bibl> et saep.</sense><sense id="n12628.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12628.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to give up, yield, devote, dedicate;</hi> and with se, <hi rend="ital">to give up, apply, devote, dedicate one's self</hi> (esp. freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">Davo ego istuc dedam jam negoti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 5, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra molli somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures suas poetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum sacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cupiditati crudelitatique alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">filiam (Verginiam) libidini App. Claudii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; ef. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam liberto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus sum, tibi dedo operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ei dediderit operas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora paupertate dedita morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se totum Catoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (sc. patriae) nos totos dedere ... debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se toto animo huic discendi delectationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se penitus musicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se literis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ei studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:35" default="NO">11, 1, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se amicitiae eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me totum aegritudini dedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se totos libidinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 43, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se ad audiendum, legendum scribendumque dediderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dede neci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:840" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 840</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad literas memoriasque veteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se doctrinae penitus dedidissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: dediderim periculis omnibus, Cic.
