Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12628.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭta ŏpĕra</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adverb., purposely, designedly, intentionally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 2</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 433, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the order opera dedita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 193</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in MSS. ellipt., dedita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">dedita</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)pithde/s</foreign>, Gloss. —</sense><sense id="n12628.7" n="B" level="2"> In Partic.: manus, for the usual <hi rend="ital">dare</hi> manus, <hi rend="ital">to give up, to yield</hi>: si tibi vera videntur, dede manus; <cit><quote lang="la">aut, si falsum est, accingere contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1043" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1043</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.), <hi rend="ital">given up to, addicted, devoted to</hi> something; <hi rend="ital">eager, assiduous, diligent</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n12628.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc magis sum Publio deditus, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis equestri ordini deditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum voluntati et gratiae deditus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio literarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">literis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 30, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec studio citharae nec Musae deditus ulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:105 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 105 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus libidini deditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis flagitiisque omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventri atque somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">somno ciboque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis gaudiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 85:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestui atque sumptui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agriculturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Tim. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxoribus deditior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: ab optimo certe animo ac deditissimo tibi, Dolab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12628.9" n="(b)" level="5"> In Lucret. and Catull. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pugnae studio quod dedita mens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 816</bibl></cit>; Catull. 61, 102.—* </sense><sense id="n12628.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi spectaculi tempus venit deditaeque eo (sc. ad spectacula) mentes cum oculis erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedoceo: <entryFree id="n12629" type="main" key="de_do^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n12629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cause</hi> one <hi rend="ital">to unlearn</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to unteach, teach the opposite of</hi> (rare, but class.). </sense><sense id="n12629.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <cb n="DEDU" /> double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem geometriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnorum gaudia temet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:409" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 409</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12629.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(virtus) populum falsis Dedocet uti Vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12629.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aut docendus is est aut dedocendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a Zenone fortis esse didicisset, a dolore dedoctus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 60</bibl></cit>. In the gerund <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus dedocendi gravius quam docendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut coercendi magis quam dedocendi esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Fin. 1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedolentia: <entryFree id="n12630" type="gloss" key="de_do^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the abandonment of grief, ceasing to lament</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)palghsi/a</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
dedoleo: <entryFree id="n12631" type="main" key="de_do^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <sense id="n12631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to give over grieving, grieve no more</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:480" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 480</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 294</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dedolo: <entryFree id="n12632" type="main" key="de_do^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to hew away, to hew smooth, to hew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes putres pedamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasculum crystallo dedolatum,</quote> <trans><tr>smoothed, inlaid</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa fracta fabrili manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:84" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 84</bibl></cit>.—Jocosely: <cit><quote lang="la">senem Exossabo dein dedolabo assulatim viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 106</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in familiar lang., <hi rend="ital">to cudgel soundly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fustium quoque crebris ictibus dedolabar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in an obscene sense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 220, 30.</sense></entryFree>
dedomo: <entryFree id="n12633" type="main" key="de_do^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dŏmo</orth>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tame</hi>: equam, Commodian. 34, 3.</sense></entryFree>
deduco: <entryFree id="n12634" type="main" key="de_du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum</itype> (<sense id="n12634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deduc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:21:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 21, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">old form, deduce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 32</bibl></cit>), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring away, to lead, fetch, bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw down</hi> (for syn. cf.: duco, comitor, prosequor, persequor, stipo, sequor, consequor—freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12634.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12634.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12634.3" n="a" level="4"> Not designating a limit: <cit><quote lang="la">atomos de via,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn from a straight course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum concionari conantem de rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes de lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos clam ex agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex ultimis gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunam e curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the foll.: summā vestem deduxit ab orā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantando rigidas deducere montibus ornos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 71</bibl></cit>: lunam caelo <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 69</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lunam cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:317" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominam Ditis thalamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota carbasa malo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to spread, unfurl, by letting down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 477</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the foll.: febres corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfuga duci se ad consules jubet deductusque traditurum urbem promittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubiis imperat, ut pecora deducant suaque omnia ex agris in oppida conferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl>: rivos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to clear out, cleanse</hi> ( = detergere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 269</bibl> Heyne ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua Albana deducta ad utilitatem agri suburbani,</quote> <trans><tr>conducted off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem,</quote> <trans><tr>the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines pectine,</quote> <trans><tr>to comb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 311</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caesariem barbae dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:656" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:663" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive aliquis molli deducit candida gestu Brachia,</quote> <trans><tr>moves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit> (3, 15), 5 (al. diducit); imitated by <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 3, 5, 66</bibl> (al. diducit) et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12634.4" n="b" level="4"> Stating the limit: <cit><quote lang="la">cito hunc deduc ad militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 113 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem ad altos currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas vestes humero ad pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 405</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manum ad imum ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 112</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta in proximum collem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 68, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam in vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:155" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 582</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in conspectum (Caesaris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: levis deducet pondere fratres, <hi rend="ital">will bring down</hi> (the scale), <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 292</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12634.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12634.6" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw off, lead off, withdraw</hi> troops from a place; <hi rend="ital">to lead, conduct, bring</hi> to a place: praesidia de locis, Sisenna ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 289, 15</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 51, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ex his regionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 19</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 87, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:12:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 12, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem ab opere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 69</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 35 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducta Orico legione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum finibus Attali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 27</bibl></cit>: deducto <cb n="DEDU" /> exercitu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 20, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 39 al.</bibl>; cf. Oud. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites ad Ciceronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres in arcem cohortes praesidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Flacco inter ceteros, quos virtutis causa secum ex provincia ad triumphum deducebat, deductus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias ex locis superioribus in campum deducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionibus in hiberna deductis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 35, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in interiorem Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in Menapios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proxima municipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hiberna in Sequanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque more militari vigiliae deducebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Jug. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Jug. 44, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 59, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12634.7" n="2" level="3"> Pub. law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to lead forth, conduct</hi> a colony to a place: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni, qui lege Julia Capuam deducti erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonos in aliquem locum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloniam in aliquem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:45" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 45</bibl> (repeatedly); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquileia colonia Latina eo anno in agro Gallorum est deducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in colonia Capua deducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut emantur agri a privatis, quo plebs publice deducatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 34, 92: triumvir coloniis deducendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:46 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 46 al.</bibl>— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deductis olim et nobiscum per conubium sociatis, haec patria est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 65</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12634.8" n="3" level="3"> Nautical t. t. </sense><sense id="n12634.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To draw out</hi> a ship from the docks: <cit><quote lang="la">ex navalibus eorum unam (navem) deducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducunt socii naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 71</bibl></cit>.—Hence far more freq. meton., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kaqe/lkein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to draw down</hi> a ship from the stocks into the sea; <hi rend="ital">to launch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque multum abesse (naves) ab eo, quin paucis diebus deduci possent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 41 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 104</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12634.10" n="b" level="4"> Rarely for subducere and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kata/gein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> a ship <hi rend="ital">into port</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerarias naves in portum deducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 101, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12634.11" n="4" level="3"> Weavers' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to draw out, spin out</hi> the thread, yarn: <cit><quote lang="la">dextera tum leviter deducens fila, Catull. 64, 313: filum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 77</bibl>.—Hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">to prepare a web, to weave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus in tela deducitur argumentum,</quote> <trans><tr>is interwoven, represented in weaving</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.12" n="5" level="3"> t. t. of common life, <hi rend="ital">to lead out, conduct, escort, accompany</hi> a person out of the house, as a mark of respect or for protection: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa sunt honorabilia ... assurgi, deduci, reduci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 18, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magna multitudo optimorum virorum et civium me de domo deduceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne deducendi sui causa populum de foro abduceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus (sc. equitibus Rom.) si domus nostra celebratur, si interdum ad forum deducimur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.13" n="b" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to conduct a young man to a public teacher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam hunc a patre continuo ad me esse deductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 6</bibl>; cf. ephebum in gymnasium, Petron. 85, 3.—</sense><sense id="n12634.14" n="c" level="4"> Aliquam alicui, ad aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to lead, conduct a bride</hi> (from her father's house) <hi rend="ital">to her husband</hi> (cf. denubo): <cit><quote lang="la">bona uxor si ea deducta est usquam cuiquam gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Catull. 68, 143: virginem juveni marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni nuptam, ad quem virgo deducta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo exemplo deductae in domum patrui fratris filiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 63</bibl></cit>; so of the bridegroom himself, <hi rend="ital">to take home the bride</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum in cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo primum virgo quaeque deducta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas velut auspicibus nobilissimis populis deductas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 13.— </sense><sense id="n12634.15" n="(b)" level="5"> In a dishonorable sense, <hi rend="ital">to bring one a concubine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Casin. 2, 8, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 28</bibl>; cf. also the foll., <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 7.—</sense><sense id="n12634.16" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To lead about in a public procession</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidens privata deduci superbo non humilis mulier triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 37, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.17" n="e" level="4"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">to drive out, expel</hi> = expellere: Arsinoen ex regno, Auct. B. <pb n="527" /> <cb n="DEDU" /> Alex. 33: <cit><quote lang="la">ex possessione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 58, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12634.18" n="6" level="3"> Jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n12634.19" n="a" level="4"> Aliquem de fundo, <hi rend="ital">to lead away a person from a disputed possession</hi> in the presence of witnesses (with or without force: the latter moribus, the former vi solida), in order to procure him the right of action (this was a symbolic procedure preparatory to an action): appellat Fabius, ut aut ipse Tullium deduceret aut ab eo deduceretur. Dicit deducturum se Tullius, etc., Cic. pro Tull. Fragm. § 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Agr. 2:26:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 68</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">placuit Caecinae constituere, quo die in rem praesentem veniretur, et de fundo Caecina moribus deduceretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Caecin. 7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.20" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bring before a tribunal as a witness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi boni ad hoc judicium deducti non sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,017:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Flac. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.21" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to trial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lis ad forum deducta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12634.22" n="7" level="3"> With the accessory idea of diminution, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw, deduct, subtract, diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>. And as a mercantile t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">addendo deducendoque videre, quae reliqui summa fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut centum nummi deducerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:144 sq" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 144 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de capite deducite, quod usuris pernumeratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl> et saep.—Hence in a double sense: Tertia deducta est (in allusion to the meaning, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 5, c. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl>; cf. the same account in <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12634.23" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12634.24" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring down, bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lead away, withdraw, bring, lead</hi>: quare, si placet, deduc orationem tuam de coelo ad haec citeriora, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 85, 20</bibl>, and 289, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">licet enim contrahere universitatem generis humani, eamque gradatim ad pauciores, postremo deducere in singulos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de animi lenitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de animi pravitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 10" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">perterritos a timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a tristitia, ab acerbitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab humanitate, a pietate, a religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit> (for which, shortly before, abducere): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a vera accusatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntates impellere quo velit, unde autem velit deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos unde deductus,</quote> <trans><tr>derived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen ab Anco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:803" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tandem ea est disciplina, ad quam me deducas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,045:2:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Acad. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad fletum misericordiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad eam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad otium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura argumenta ad unum effectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 103</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam in fortunam quamque in amplitudinem deduxisset (Aeduos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 54, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in eum casum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in periculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in summum periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 63, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in societatem belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc jam deduxerat rem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 62</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rem huc, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 86, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deduxisti totam hanc rem in duo genera solum causarum, caetera innumerabilia exercitationi reliquisti,</quote> <trans><tr>have brought, reduced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in eum locum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem in locum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo huc universa causa deducitur, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum divisio in duos articulos deducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audi, quo rem deducam,</quote> <trans><tr>what I aim at, what I have in view, to what conclusion I will bring the matter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeolium carmen ad Italos modos,</quote> <trans><tr>transfer, transplant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 3, 30, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in patriam deducere musas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12634.25" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12634.26" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mislead, seduce, entice, induce, bring</hi> one to an opinion (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentibus et oratione magistratus et praemio deductis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi esse facile, Seuthen regem Thracum deducere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vero,</quote> <trans><tr>from the truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 370</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.27" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To spin out</hi> a literary composition, like a thread, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to elaborate, prepare, compose</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tenui deducta poëmata filo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille die versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sat. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:1:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 71</bibl>: nihil expositum,<cb n="DEDU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio deducta atque circumlata,</quote> <trans><tr>finely spun out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:60 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 60 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primaque ab origine mundi ad mea perpetuum deducite tempora carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:560" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 560</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12634.28" n="3" level="3"> (Another figure borrowed from spinning.) <hi rend="ital">To make finer, thinner, weaker; to attenuate</hi>: vocem deducas oportet, ut mulieris videantur verba, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 6, 4</bibl>: "<foreign lang="greek">*)odusseu/s</foreign>" ad "Ulixem" deductus est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 16</bibl>; cf. <pos>P. a.</pos> B.— </sense><sense id="n12634.29" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To derive</hi> (of the origin of words): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Christianorum a Christo deducitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. de Virg. vel. 5: diximus nomen religionis a vinculo pietatis esse deductum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 28, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed et Pharnacion (cognominatur) a Pharnace rege deductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 14, § 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.30" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To remove, cure</hi>, of physical evils: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica de capite omnia deducet et sanum faciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:6" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore febres, animo curas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 17, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.31" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring down</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deducis ad inferos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tobiae, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:42:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 42, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12634.32" n="7" level="3"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to withhold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in mancipanda proprietate (usus fructus) deducatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:33" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
deductus: <entryFree id="n12635" type="main" key="de_ductus1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <sense id="n12635.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Drawn inwards, bent inwards</hi> (only post-Aug.), said of the nose: <cit><quote lang="la">nasum et a summo eminentiorem et ab imo deductiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus deductus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Diadum. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12635.1" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">Slender, weak</hi> (ante-class., and once in Verg.): deducta tunc voce leo, <hi rend="ital">with a weak, subdued voice</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 289, 16</bibl>: deducta voce, Afran. and Cornificius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 6, 4</bibl>: carmen, <hi rend="ital">a humble strain</hi>, opp. to canere reges et proelia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 5</bibl> (<hi rend="ital">tenue translatio a lana, quae deducitur in tenuitatem</hi>, Serv.); cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 6, 4</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl>.!*? In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:20:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 20, 50</bibl>, deductio, not deducta, is the true reading.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n12641" type="main" key="de_ductus2" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from deduco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12642" type="main" key="de_ductus3" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēductus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deduco</etym>, <sense id="n12642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dragging down</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ponderis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109, 28</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl>, the true reading is: ductus aquarum).</sense></entryFree>
deductim: <entryFree id="n12636" type="gloss" key="de_ductim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēductim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, acc. to Diomed. p. 168 [deduco].</entryFree>
deductio: <entryFree id="n12637" type="main" key="de_ducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deduco</etym>, <sense id="n12637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading away, leading on</hi>, in accordance with the different acceptations of the primitive word. </sense><sense id="n12637.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12637.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: rivorum a fonte, <hi rend="ital">a leading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conducting off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Albanae aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12637.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12637.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A leading forth, transplanting</hi> of colonies, <hi rend="ital">a colonizing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae erit in istos agros deductio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum in oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 52, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12637.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A leading away of the bride</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsae in domum mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12637.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An escorting, a conducting safely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Jacob. 2, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12637.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A putting out of possession, ejection, expulsion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi tum Caecinam postulasse, ut moribus deductio fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12637.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A deduction, diminution</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">HERES SINE DEDVCTIONE XX., i. e. vicesimarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3041</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vicesimus. So, sine deductione,</quote> <trans><tr>without deduction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12637.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac deductione rationis,</quote> <trans><tr>from this course of reasoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deductivus: <entryFree id="n12638" type="main" key="de_ducti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēductīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deduco</etym>, <sense id="n12638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">derivative</hi>: nomina, Pomp. Comm. art. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 19, 4, p. 202</bibl> K.</sense></entryFree>
deductor: <entryFree id="n12639" type="main" key="de_ductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n12639.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who brings; a guide, teacher</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>: veritatis, Tert. Cor. mil. 4.—</sense><sense id="n12639.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to deduco, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 1. B. 5.) <hi rend="ital">One who accompanies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attends on</hi> a candidate for office, <hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deductorius: <entryFree id="n12640" type="main" key="de_ducto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēductōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for drawing off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draining</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <trans><tr>aperient, purgative</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuniculus (in stabulis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56</bibl></cit>. Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">deducto-rium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a drain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dedux: <entryFree id="n12643" type="main" key="de_dux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēdux</orth>, <itype>ŭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n12643.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Derived</hi>, <cb n="DEFA" /> <hi rend="ital">descended</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:68" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12643.1" n="II" level="1"> = conditor, on a coin ap. Eckhel. IV. p. 347.</sense></entryFree>
deebriatus: <entryFree id="n12644" type="main" key="de^e_bri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ēbrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., made drunk, inebriated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex. 1</bibl>; ad Thessal. 5 al.</sense></entryFree>
deeo: <entryFree id="n12645" type="main" key="de^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īre, for abeo</itype>, very doubtful; defended by Gronov. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:551" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 551</bibl>; cf.: <sense id="n12645.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ullis ad signa deeuntibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. in Mai. Auct. Class. 1, p. 418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Fragm. in Mai. Auct. Class. 1, p. 418</bibl></cit> (dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex redeuntibus corruptum, Dietsch,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. 3:67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. 3, 67, 2</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
deerro: <entryFree id="n12646" type="main" key="de^erro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-erro</orth> (in the poets dissyllabic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 711</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 7 al.</bibl>), āvi, ātum, 1, <sense id="n12646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to wander away, stray, go astray, go the wrong way, lose one's way</hi> (rare, but class.). </sense><sense id="n12646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deerrare a patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 54</bibl></cit> (for which <hi rend="ital">aberrare</hi> a patre, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 31): qui in itinere deerravissent, * Cic. Ac. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: vir gregis ipse caper deerraverat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi deerantes via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1070" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1070</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12646.2" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate subjects, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 873</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculantium ictus deerraturos negant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si potus cibusve in alienum deerravit tramitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12646.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to err, stray, deviate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnopere a vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo quod coeperimus exponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia sors deerrabat ad parum idoneos,</quote> <trans><tr>fell upon improper persons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi semel recto deerratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos enim deerrasse memoria prodidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defaecabilis: <entryFree id="n12647" type="hapax" key="de_faeca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfaecābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">defec-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>defaeco</etym>, <sense id="n12647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be easily cleansed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cisterna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defaecatio: <entryFree id="n12648" type="hapax" key="de_faeca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfaecātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">defec-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleansing, purifying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defaeco: <entryFree id="n12649" type="main" key="de_faeco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-faeco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfēco</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">defīco</orth>; cf. Ritschl ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 2</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>faex</etym>, <sense id="n12649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse from dregs; to refine, purify, defecate, clarify</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n12649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 63, § 232</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 25, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12649.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cleanse, purify, wash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aërem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12649.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to purify; to make clear, serene; to set at ease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid incerti mi in animo prius aut ambiguum fuit, nunc liquet, nunc defaecatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus purgatus defaecatusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">literae defaecandae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro ab omni defaecata labe vitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 141 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc defaecato demum animo egredior domo,</quote> <trans><tr>undisturbed, serene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfaecātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum defaecatius ab omni labe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>; Serm. 8; <cit><quote lang="la">vindemiae,</quote> <trans><tr>refined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 25, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defamatus: <entryFree id="n12650" type="main" key="de_fa_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fāmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fama</etym>, <sense id="n12650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dishonored, infamous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo turpitudine pristinae vitae defamatissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
defamis: <entryFree id="n12651" type="main" key="de_fa_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfāmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>de-fama</etym>, <sense id="n12651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
defanatus: <entryFree id="n12652" type="main" key="de_fa_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fānātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fanum</etym>, <sense id="n12652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">profaned, desecrated, unholy</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">spatiola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 153</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4352</bibl> dub.; Gervasio reads: DE EA NATIS).</sense></entryFree>
defarinatus: <entryFree id="n12653" type="hapax" key="de_fa^ri_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fărīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>farina</etym>, <sense id="n12653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pulverized, reduced to flour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defatigatio: <entryFree id="n12654" type="main" key="de_fa^ti_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfătīgātĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">defĕt-</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defatigo</etym>. <sense id="n12654.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., a wearying, tiring out, fatiguing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12654.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., weariness, fatigue, exhaustion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 17, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 36 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
defatigo: <entryFree id="n12655" type="main" key="de_fa^ti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fătīgo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fĕtīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to weary out, tire</hi> a person; <hi rend="ital">to fatigue; to exhaust</hi>. (For syn. cf.: fatigo, fessus, lassus, langueo, languidus, defessus. —Freq. and class.) </sense><sense id="n12655.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12655.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum crebro integri defessis succederent nostrosque assiduo labore defatigarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 41, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum Pompeii quotidianis itineribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 85, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 65</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12655.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus faciam ut defatiger usque, ingratiis ut dormiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: defatigatus vulneribus, Cato <pb n="528" /> <cb n="DEFE" /> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defatigatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and opp. integer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 85, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 40, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defatigatus est populus nimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 14, 31</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12655.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertate nimia prioris aevi defatigatum et effetum solum,</quote> <trans><tr>exhausted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 1.—</sense><sense id="n12655.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12655.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: deos suppliciis, votis, precibus, etc., Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 398, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne te adolescens mulier defatiget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores, judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12655.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te nec animi neque corporis laboribus defatigari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 1, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam conquiescam neque defatigabor ante, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 86</bibl>.—Once with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: nec defatigabor permanere in studio libertatis, Lentulus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
defatiscor: <entryFree id="n12656" type="main" key="de_fa^tiscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfătiscor</orth>, v. defetiscor.</entryFree>
defecabilis: <entryFree id="n12657" type="main" key="de_fe_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfēcābĭlis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dēfēcātĭo</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfē-co</orth>, v. defaec.</entryFree>
defectio: <entryFree id="n12658" type="main" key="de_fecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deficio</etym>. <sense id="n12658.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Defection, desertion, rebellion, revolt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12658.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebellio facta post deditionem, defectio datis obsidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 12</bibl>: Ampsivariorum a tergo, <hi rend="ital">in the rear</hi> (of Caesar), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 24</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">subita defectio Pompeii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>from the empire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12658.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperantia, quae est a tota mente et a recta ratione defectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12658.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to deficio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> III.) <hi rend="ital">A failing, failure, deficiency, want, disappearance</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12658.4" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ista ipsa defectio virium adolescentiae vitiis efficitur saepius quam senectutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum, Frontin. Aquaed. 91: pecuniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12658.5" n="b" level="4"> Esp. of the obscuration of the heavenly bodies, <hi rend="ital">an eclipse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis defectiones itemque lunae praedicuntur in multos annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 49</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12658.6" n="c" level="4"> Also (sc. virium), <hi rend="ital">exhaustion, faintness, swooning, fainting</hi> (post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: animae,</quote> <trans><tr>a swoon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvo usque ad defectionem soluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recreandae defectioni cibum adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 56</bibl></cit> (50); cf.: defectione perire, <hi rend="ital">by exhaustion</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by disease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 2:59:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N.
