Q. 2, 59, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cunctis renibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Nahum 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12658.7" n="d" level="4"> In the later grammarians, <hi rend="ital">an ellipsis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid per defectionem,</quote> <trans><tr>by ellipsis, elliptically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:14:3" default="NO">12, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 6, 8 al.</bibl>— * </sense><sense id="n12658.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintus frater omnia mittit spei plena, metuens credo defectionem animi mei,</quote> <trans><tr>my want of courage, despondency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defectivus: <entryFree id="n12659" type="main" key="de_fecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> [deficio, <sense id="n12659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> III.), <hi rend="ital">imperfect, defective</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et abortiva genitura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <trans><tr>intermittent fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12659.1" n="II" level="1"> In gramm.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina, verba, some of whose forms are wanting,</quote> <trans><tr>defective</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defector: <entryFree id="n12660" type="main" key="de_fector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deficio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</etym>, <sense id="n12660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who revolts</hi> from another; <hi rend="ital">a revolter, rebel</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">parata in defectores ultione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 50</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:13 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 1, 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris sui defectores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defectrix: <entryFree id="n12661" type="hapax" key="de_fectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>acc. to deficio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> III.</etym>, <sense id="n12661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defective, imperfect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defectus: <entryFree id="n12662" type="main" key="de_fectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from deficio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12663" type="main" key="de_fectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deficio</etym>. <sense id="n12663.0" n="I" level="1"> (For defectio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.) <hi rend="ital">Defection, revolt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno animo defectum eorum tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:19:39" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 19, 39</bibl></cit> Mützell.: <cit><quote lang="la">legionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12663.1" n="II" level="1"> ( = defectio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> III.) <hi rend="ital">A failing, failure, lack, disappearance</hi> (freq. in the elder Pliny; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): lactis (mammae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 96, § 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <trans><tr>weakness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 29, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <trans><tr>a swoon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albicante purpurae defectu,</quote> <trans><tr>fading away into white</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tanto defectu rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>freedom from occupation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 5</bibl></cit>. Of the <hi rend="ital">eclipsing</hi> of the heavenly bodies: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 751</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 478</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (sc. lunae) species ac forma mutatur tum crescendo, tum defectibus in initia recurrendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
defendo: <entryFree id="n12664" type="main" key="de_fendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum</itype> (<sense id="n12664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">infin. pass. parag.</hi>: <cb n="DEFE" /> defendier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 493</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:157" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 157</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Part. gen. plur. sync.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 886</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>arch.: FENDO; cf. Sanscr. han (ghan), <hi rend="ital">to smite;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qei/nw</foreign>; hence, also offendo, infensus, infestus, mani-festus; cf. fustis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ward off</hi> any thing hostile or injurious; <hi rend="ital">to repel, avert, keep off</hi>: propulsando arcere (for syn. cf.: tueor, tutor, servo, conservo. propugno, protego, vindico, caveo—freq. and class.); regularly constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone (so in Cic. and Caes.); very rarely <hi rend="ital">aliquid (aliquem) ab aliquo</hi>, and in poets also <hi rend="ital">aliquid alicui;</hi> cf. Zumpt. Gr. § 469. </sense><sense id="n12664.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid (aliquem)</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu morbos calamitates intemperiasque prohibessis, defendas averruncesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:141:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 141, 2</bibl></cit>: serva cives, defende hostes, cum potes defendere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 277, 21</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellum (opp. inferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad defendendos ictus ac repellendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis jactus et lapides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus et solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:48:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 48, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimios solis ardores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: sitim fonte et purā lymphā,</quote> <trans><tr>to quench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:170" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non defendit injuriam neque propulsat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 18, 74</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatoris sui tribunorumque plebis injurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim suorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 110, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vim illatam vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:905" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 905</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:99" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 99</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>to answer, defend against an accusation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 48, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12664.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: (milites) a pinnis hostes defendebant facillime, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem a fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem a tectis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 625</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12664.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid alicui</hi> (cf. arceo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. d.): <cit><quote lang="la">iniuriam foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitium pecori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem capellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela misero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:432" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:490" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senium famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:318" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 318</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12664.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., to put a stop</hi> (to a fire), <hi rend="ital">to check the flames</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam defendere audebat, crebris minis restinguere prohibentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem incendere, feris in populum immissis, quo difficilius defenderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12664.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like prohibere, with <case>acc.</case> of that from which any thing is warded off or averted, <hi rend="ital">to defend, guard, protect, cover</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12664.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (so most freq. in all perr. and species of composition), constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone; with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">ab aliquo</hi> (contra aliquid), or merely <hi rend="ital">ab aliquo;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12664.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeduos ceterosque amicos populi Rom.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 40, 6 et saep.: castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 67, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 94, 6</bibl> (with tueri): <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">eum defendo, quem tu accusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem apud praetores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 45, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de ambitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 27, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl> et passim: <cit><quote lang="la">d. ac tegere scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with protegere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <trans><tr>to preserve, maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem modo rhetoris atque poëtae,</quote> <trans><tr>to sustain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actorum partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes Vestae vix defensa est (sc. ab incendio),</quote> <trans><tr>preserved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12664.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid (aliquem) ab aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui cum se suaque ab iis defendere non possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a finitimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 75, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 45, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam omnem ab Ariovisti injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab injuria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 22, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se regnumque suum ab Romanorum avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam non modo a calamitate, sed etiam a metu calamitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: Italiam a vastatione, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam ab inimicorum audacia telisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis causam ab regio praesidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">teneras myrtos a frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes ab acutae vulnere falcis, a pecoris morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 384</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12664.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod et ab incendio lapis et ab ariete materia defendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 63, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12664.10" n="(d)" level="5"> Aliquem (aliquid) <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, or <cb n="DEFE" /> <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi> aliquem: <cit><quote lang="la">me scio a te contra iniquos meos solere defendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese adversus populum Romanum defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me adversus Abrupolim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 41, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:32" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem contra invidiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Phil, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 67, 141</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii qui et sentire et defendere possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam defenderet nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendentibus civibus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 40, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus eae partes ad defendendum obvenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n12664.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12664.12" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to defend, support, maintain; to bring forward, allege in defence</hi> (so repeatedly in Cic.; elsewhere rare). </sense><sense id="n12664.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Carneades) nullam umquam in illis suis disputationibus rem defendit, quam non probarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me id maxime defendisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>have chiefly striven for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12664.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimeque et verissime defenditur, numquam aequitatem ab utilitate posse sejungi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 90 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 13, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille nihil ex his sponte susceptum sed principi paruisse defendebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed id solitum esse fieri defendebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">verb pass.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12664.15" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">relative clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quae turpitudines) cur non cadant in sapientem, non est facile defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12664.16" n="2" level="3"> In the later jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to claim, vindicate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">prosecute at law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia libertatem et hereditatem ex testamento sibi defendebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si patris mortem defendere necesse habuerit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>legally to avenge his death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:14:section=7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 38, 2, 14, § 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:11" default="NO">48, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defenero: <entryFree id="n12665" type="main" key="de_fe_ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fēnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to involve in debt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Tobia 9</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfēnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelmed by debt, exhausted by usury</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plurimis creditoribus defeneratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 322, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defensa: <entryFree id="n12666" type="main" key="de_fensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defendo</etym>, <sense id="n12666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 18, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defensabilis: <entryFree id="n12667" type="main" key="de_fensa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>defenso</etym>, <sense id="n12667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defensible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 56, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defensator: <entryFree id="n12668" type="main" key="de_fensa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defender</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Galat. 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defensatrix: <entryFree id="n12669" type="main" key="de_fensa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who defends</hi>, Prob. p. 1452 P. (in Cicero, defenstrix, q. v.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 6, 9, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defensibilis: <entryFree id="n12670" type="main" key="de_fensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily defended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Anim. 2</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">defensibly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 79, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defensio: <entryFree id="n12671" type="main" key="de_fensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defendo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n12671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defending, defence</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12671.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Remis cum spe defensionis studium propugnandi accessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad istam omnem orationem brevis est defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra propugnatio ac defensio dignitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.— With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensio criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 49, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12671.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a written defence, speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionem Demosthenes legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12671.3" n="II" level="1"> As jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n12671.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The legal maintenance of a right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12671.5" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to defendo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Legal prosecution, punishment</hi> of a crime: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1:section=25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 1, § 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defensito: <entryFree id="n12672" type="main" key="de_fensi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. freq.</hi> [defenso], <hi rend="ital">to defend often, to practise defending</hi> (perh, only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">haec non acrius accusavit in senectute, quam antea defensitaverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 45, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
defenso: <entryFree id="n12673" type="main" key="de_fenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfenso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. intens.</hi> [defendo]. *</sense><sense id="n12673.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fend off diligently, ward off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:105" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12673.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To defend diligently, protect</hi> (rare; mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, not in Cic. or Caes.): <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes">60, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios ab hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsa moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 45</bibl></cit> (al. defendebant): <cit><quote lang="la">se injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum defensamus (sc. armentum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 374</bibl></cit>. <pb n="529" /> <cb n="DEFE" /></sense></entryFree>
defensor: <entryFree id="n12674" type="main" key="de_fensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, rar. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n12674.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who fends, wards, averts</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">keeps off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12674.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A defender, protector</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12674.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor, praeses, vindex, cognitor, curator, patronus, advocatus, causidicus): paterni juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 244</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris et libertatis, id. Rab. perd. 4, 12: octo tribuni plebis, illius adversarii, defensores mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 30</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. petitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:132" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. accusator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:3" default="NO">5, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:38:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 38, § 82</bibl> et saep.; cf. patronus. Once <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier defensor alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes defensores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12674.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp. in <number>plur.</number>, defensores, <hi rend="ital">the garrison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum vacuum ab defensoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 25</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 521</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 274</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12674.4" n="3" level="3"> Defensor civitatis, <hi rend="ital">or</hi> plebis, <hi rend="ital">or</hi> loci, in the later period of the empire (since 365 A.D.), title of a magistrate in the provincial cities, whose chief duty was to afford protection against oppression on the part of the governor; <cit><quote lang="la">he was likewise endowed with a subordinate civil jurisdiction,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:20:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 20, 5</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12674.5" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects, as the <hi rend="ital">guards</hi> (sublicae) of a bridge, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
defensorius: <entryFree id="n12675" type="main" key="de_fenso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfensōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to defence</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">judicia bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 14 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
defenstrix: <entryFree id="n12676" type="main" key="de_fenstrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfenstrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defensor</etym>, <sense id="n12676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who defends</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1120</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
defero: <entryFree id="n12677" type="main" key="de_fe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, lātum, ferre</itype>, <sense id="n12677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring away</hi> a thing from a place; <hi rend="ital">to bear, carry, bring down</hi>.</sense><sense id="n12677.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12677.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12677.3" n="1" level="3"> Without stating the <hi rend="ital">terminus</hi> (not very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">roseam Auroram per oras Aetheris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 656</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:273" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:639" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 639</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanus amnis segnem deferens Ararim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:136" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 27, 31, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 117</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">ex Helicone coronam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramalia arida tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 646</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina liquida ac deferentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n12677.4" n="2" level="3"> Indicating the <hi rend="ital">terminus</hi> (by <hi rend="ital">ad, in, an adv. of place</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">literas ad Caesarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolam ad Ciceronem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 48, 3</bibl></cit> and 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum ad gnatum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">natos ad flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani ad castra Romanorum delati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">semen quod ex arbore per surculos defertur in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum et omnia ornamenta sua in aerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes in planum et colli subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum in pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem in campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praeceps deferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps in undas deferar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:228" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 269</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc sub aequora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>submerge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasdam (virgines) ex plebe homines domos deferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte eo (sc. Demetriadem) deferret fuga regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pennis delata sit ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pallam mihi Detulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">epistolas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 109</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n12677.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12677.6" n="1" level="3"> Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to drive away, drive down, drive</hi> a ship, or those on board a ship, to any place: <cit><quote lang="la">onerariae duae paullo infra delatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">una (navis) delata Oricum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Labienus) longius delatus aestu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cum ex alto ignotas ad terras tempestas et in desertum litus detulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12677.7" n="b" level="4"> Rarely in gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring, convey</hi> to any place (as a ship, its passengers): <cit><quote lang="la">e portu navis huc nos dormientes detulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12677.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Mercant. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring to market, to sell</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nexos maniplos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:315" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 315</bibl></cit>: pallium. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videamus hoc, quod concupiscimus, quanti deferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 42" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 42</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12677.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12677.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redde harmoniaī Nomen, ab organicis alto delatum Heliconi,</quote> <trans><tr>brought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alexander) eadem fortunae pignora in discrimen detulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulas in certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: hac re ad consilium delata, <hi rend="ital">having been taken</hi> <cb n="DEFE" /> <hi rend="ital">into consideration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad consilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad agendum nihil cogitati detulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(poëta) si foret hoc nostrum delatus in aevum, Detereret sibi multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 68</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12677.11" n="B" level="2"> With particular accessory notions. </sense><sense id="n12677.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring, give</hi> to one, <hi rend="ital">grant, confer upon, allot, to offer</hi> to any one, <hi rend="ital">transfer, deliver</hi> (for syn. v. do—very freq.). </sense><sense id="n12677.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid ad aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc totius belli summam omnium voluntate deferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; 7, 4, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem rem ad Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad unum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 23, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam ad Galbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primas ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12677.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid alicui</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi a Caesare regnum civitatis deferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; Fasti ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 87</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum et diadema uni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces indigno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium dignitatis alicui (opp. denegare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro ei legationem (opp. denegare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmam alicujus rei Crasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem ei auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Octaviam neptem condicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n12677.15" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum,</quote> <trans><tr>to tender an oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 3 and § 4; <cit><quote lang="la">si quid petet, ultro defer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 23</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12677.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give an account of, to report, announce, signify, state</hi> (for syn. v. declaro <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>— <cit><quote lang="la">very freq.): qui nostra consilia ad adversarios deferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (haec) per eos ad Caesarem deferrentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; so with <hi rend="ital">per</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 30, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 63, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad Caesarem detulerint delaturive sint, me poenitere consilii mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; so with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:299 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 299 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12677.17" n="b" level="4"> Legal t. t.: nomen, and post-Aug., aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to indict, impeach, accuse</hi> before the pretor, as plaintiff or informer (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">denuntio, indico): nomen alicujus de parricidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen amici mei de ambitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 23</bibl>; nomen suo familiari (<case>dat.</case>) eadem de re, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 33, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illi nonnihil tamen in deferendo nomine secuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deferendos reos praemio duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reos ad praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reos ejusdem criminis detulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">defertur majestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48</bibl></cit> (v. Draeger ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">adulterii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impietatis in principem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Drusus defertur moliri res novas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">defertur simulavisse partum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deferenda de Perseo crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 98</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: et cum occiderentur, detuli sententiam,</quote> <trans><tr>voted to condemn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 26, 10</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et minari et deferre etiam non orator potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">denouncing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae apud vos de me deferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12677.18" n="c" level="4"> Pub. law t. t. </sense><sense id="n12677.19" n="(a)" level="5"> Aliquid ad aerarium, and more freq. simply aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to give in at the Aerarium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum nomina ad aerarium detulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam rationes deferre properarim (for which referre is repeatedly used just before),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence of persons, <hi rend="ital">to recommend</hi> them for future consideration and reward, for their services to the state: <cit><quote lang="la">in beneficiis ad aerarium delatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum factum ad aerarium deferre,</quote> <trans><tr>the public archives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12677.20" n="(b)" level="5"> Deferre in censum, <hi rend="ital">to report</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">for assessment, to return</hi> one's property <hi rend="ital">to the censors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille quingentum aeris in censum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, deferre censum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 41</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. in mid. force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deferri in censum,</quote> <trans><tr>to report one's self for assessment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12677.21" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To ascribe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deferunda: <entryFree id="n12678" type="gloss" key="De_fe^runda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēfĕrunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, perh. <sense id="n12678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess that presided over the bringing of offerings</hi>, Inscr. Fratr. Arval. ap. Orell. I. p. 390.</sense></entryFree>
defervefacio: <entryFree id="n12679" type="main" key="de_ferve^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fervĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to seethe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause to boil</hi>.—</sense><sense id="n12679.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:9" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam in aëno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem in vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 129</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12679.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: aër defervefactus<cb n="DEFI" />  in pulmone, <hi rend="ital">heated</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. Dei 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deferveo: <entryFree id="n12680" type="main" key="de_ferve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fervĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n12680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to boil thoroughly;</hi> of wine, <hi rend="ital">to ferment completely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 85</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of lime and water,</quote> <trans><tr>to effervesce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12680.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to subside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defervesco: <entryFree id="n12681" type="main" key="de_fervesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fervesco</orth>, <itype>fervi and ferbui</itype> (defervi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:39:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 39, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:96:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 96, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:16:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 16, 2 al.</bibl>: <sense id="n12681.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">deferbui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 2</bibl> et saep.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">to cease boiling, leave off raging</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12681.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi lupinus deferverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:96" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum musteus fructus defervescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deferbuit mustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 38, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:2" default="NO">12, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi caelum enituit et deferbuit mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12681.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12681.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the fire of passion, <hi rend="ital">to cease raging, to cool down, to be allayed, assuaged</hi> (a favorite expression of Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): ut ulciscendi vim differant in tempus aliud, dum defervescat ira: defervescere autem certe significat ardorem animi invita ratione excitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperabam jam defervisse adolescentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adolescentiae cupiditates defervissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi deferverat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum studia defervisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum defervescat haec gratulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis indignatio deferbuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12681.4" n="B" level="2"> (Fig. from the fermenting of wine.) <hi rend="ital">To become clarified, clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi versiculi ut primum videbuntur defervisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
defessus: <entryFree id="n12682" type="main" key="de_fessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of defetiscor.</entryFree>
defetigo: <entryFree id="n12683" type="main" key="de_fe^ti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfĕtīgo</orth>, v. defatigo.</entryFree>
defetiscentia: <entryFree id="n12684" type="hapax" key="de_fe^tiscenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfĕtiscentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defetiscor</etym>, <sense id="n12684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weariness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defetiscor: <entryFree id="n12685" type="main" key="de_fe^tiscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fĕtiscor</orth> (in MSS. sometimes defatiscor), fessus, 3, <sense id="n12685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to become tired</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearied; to grow weary, faint; to be exhausted</hi>. (For syn. v. defatigo. As a <hi rend="ital">verb. fin.</hi> ante-class. and rare, but class. and freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque defetiscar experirier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum defessus reperire, vos defessi quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:54 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 54 sq.</bibl></cit> (for which, sum defessus quaeritando, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 1, 6</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non si quid malae pugnae acciderit, defetiscendum, Front. B. Parth.: ego vapulando, ille verberando usque ambo defessi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; so, defessus with <hi rend="ital">abl. gerund.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 7</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 392, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 198</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerunda aqua defessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">abl. nominis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturnitate pugnae defessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the foll.: defessus totius diei labore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 88, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultu agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensibus negotiis atque urbano opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 57</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicio (aures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">semperque ipsi recentes defessis succederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; so opp. recens <hi rend="ital">or</hi> integer, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 41, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 94, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defessi Aeneadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 285</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">565</bibl>: defessus omnibus medullis, Catul. 55, 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 54.—</sense><sense id="n12685.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores defatiscentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita defessa ac refrigerata accusatio,</quote> <trans><tr>weakened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orant defessis subeant rebus, i. e. afflictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:566" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 566</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deficientia: <entryFree id="n12686" type="main" key="de_fi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wanting, want</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 23, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deficio: <entryFree id="n12687" type="main" key="de_fi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n12687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>: defexit, an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, see below, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> III. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> In the pass., besides the regular form deficior, ante- and postclass., once in Verg., Propert., and Livy, like fīo, eri: defit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deflunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. conficio <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>facio</etym>, orig., <hi rend="ital">to loosen, set free, remove from;</hi> but it passed over at a very early period into the middle sense, <hi rend="ital">to loosen from one's self, to remove one's self, to break loose from;</hi> and then gradually assumed the character of a new <hi rend="ital">verb. act.</hi>, with the meaning <hi rend="ital">to leave, desert</hi>, <pb n="530" /> <cb n="DEFI" /> <hi rend="ital">depart from</hi> something, or <hi rend="ital">absol., to depart, cease, fail</hi>. (For syn. cf.: desum, absum, descisco, negligo.) </sense><sense id="n12687.1" n="I" level="1"> Act. in the middle sense, <hi rend="ital">to remove one's self, separate one's self, to withdraw</hi> (cf. the Greek <foreign lang="greek">a)fista/nai</foreign>).—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to forsake, desert, abandon, revolt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12687.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab amicitia P. R.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 39, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Aeduis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(consules) a senatu, a republica, a bonis omnibus defecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a republica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imperio ac nomine nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">a patribus ad plebem,</quote> <trans><tr>to go over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Poenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates quae defecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 10 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n12687.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si a virtute defeceris,</quote> <trans><tr>forsake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si utilitas ab amicitia defecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a me ipse deficerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12687.4" n="II" level="1"> As a <hi rend="ital">verb. act., to leave</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to desert, to fail, forsake, be wanting to</hi> (of things; <cit><quote lang="la">very rarely of personal subjects): quem jam sanguis viresque deficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B.
