C. 3, 99 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Leontina civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 28</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 13</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">res eos jam pridem, fides deficere nuper coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me dies, vox, latera deficiant, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit> (imitated word for word, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 9</bibl>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne te de republica disserentem deficiat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus te citius quam oratio deficeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus si te non deficit aequus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus sollicitas domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: genitor Phaethontis orbem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is eclipsed</hi> (cf. III. B. infra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 382</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: nec me deficiet nautas rogitare citatos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I will not cease</hi>, etc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 23</bibl> Kuin.—</sense><sense id="n12687.5" n="b" level="4"> Pass.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aquilifer jam viribus deficeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:64:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 64, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier a menstruis defecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier abundat audacia, consilio et ratione deficitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 65, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua ciboque defecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine defecti artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 96</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui dotem promisit defectus sit facultatibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unable to pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te defecta nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12687.6" n="III" level="1"> Middle or neuter, <hi rend="ital">to run out, be wanting, fail, cease, disappear</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12687.7" n="A" level="2"> Middle (mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n12687.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: mihi fortuna magis nunc defit, quam genus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac mihi non aestate novum, non frigore defit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12687.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque opsonium defiat neque supersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. superesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut defiat dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquamne causa defiet, cur? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectis (sc. animo) defensoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>disheartened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed non usque eo defectum Germanicum,</quote> <trans><tr>weakened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> B. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.—</sense><sense id="n12687.10" n="B" level="2"> Neuter. </sense><sense id="n12687.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so rarely; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum non solum vires, sed etiam tela nostris deficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so perh.: vires nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 41, 7</bibl></cit> (al. nostros); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:661" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 661</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:10:193" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 10, 193</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:445" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 445</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12687.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (freq. in all periods and kinds of composition): <cit><quote lang="la">non frumentum deficere poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus ex arboribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 58</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus generis copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus anni ad bellum gerendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ne mihi crimina non suppeterent, ne oratio deesset, ne vox viresque deficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi memoria forte defecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non deficiente crumena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod plena luna defecisset,</quote> <trans><tr>was eclipsed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solem lunae oppositum solere deficere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16</bibl></cit> al.; also simply <hi rend="ital">to set</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua venit exoriens, qua deficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: lunā deficiente, <hi rend="ital">waning</hi> (opp. crescente), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 5</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">fire</hi> and <hi rend="ital">light, to go out, expire, become extinct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progenies Caesarum in Nerone deficit,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes extinct, dies out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:39:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 39, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but deficit ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>does not extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac voce defecit,</quote> <trans><tr>he departed, expired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl> prooem. § 11: deficit<cb n="DEFI" />  omne quod nascitur, <hi rend="ital">comes to an end</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 79</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum deficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deficit vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">quod multi Gallicis tot bellis defecerant,</quote> <trans><tr>had been lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima jam passi comites bello Deficiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>grow faint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deficit Matho,</quote> <trans><tr>fails, becomes bankrupt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:129" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:3:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimenta defecerant,</quote> <trans><tr>yielded, surrendered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne negotio desisteret neu animo deficeret,</quote> <trans><tr>nor be disheartened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, ne deficiant (apes) animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>; and in a like sense <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne una plaga accepta patres conscripti conciderent, ne deficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deficit ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 537</bibl></cit>: illis legibus populus Romanus prior non deficiet: si prior defexit publico consilio dolo malo, tu illo die, Juppiter, etc., <hi rend="ital">to depart from, violate the conditions of a treaty</hi>, an old formula used in taking an oath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnando deficere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be deficient, wanting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with foll. <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppeditare Materies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1039" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1039</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:112" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:191" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 191</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> III.), <hi rend="ital">weak, weakened, worn out, enfeebled</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod sibi defectis illa tulisset opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:674" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectus annis et desertus viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">defectissimus annis et viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">12: senio (arbor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:285" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadit incerto pede, jam viribus defecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 374" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectae senectutis homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:12:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 12, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tumidis et globosis (speculis) omnia defectiora (corresp. with paria and auctiora),</quote> <trans><tr>smaller</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 283</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfecti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera obscura attributa defectis,</quote> <trans><tr>the weak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defigo: <entryFree id="n12688" type="main" key="de_fi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to fasten down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in;</hi> and with especial reference to the terminus, <hi rend="ital">to drive, fix</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fasten into</hi> (class.). —</sense><sense id="n12688.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: in campo Martio crucem ad civium supplicium defigi et constitui jubes, Cic. Rab. perd. 4; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tigna machinationibus immissa in flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes sub aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asseres in terra defigebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verutum in balteo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicam in consulis corpore,</quote> <trans><tr>to thrust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrum in corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellure hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 130</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 652</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium superne jugulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:436 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 436 al.</bibl>: cruci defiguntur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem penitus terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te hodie, si prehendero, defigam in terram colaphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit> (for which, shortly after, cruci affigere): <cit><quote lang="la">morsus in aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 12, 12, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavum percussum malleo in cerebrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 4, 21</bibl></cit>; Eccles. 12, 11. —</sense><sense id="n12688.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (Causa pro effectu.) <hi rend="ital">To fix, fasten, render immovable</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">defixa caelo sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defixere aciem in his vestigiis,</quote> <trans><tr>have fixed them motionless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">defixi et Neronem intuentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedeo defixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me defixum in ora, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12688.3" n="C" level="2"> Esp. in phrase, manus defigere, <hi rend="ital">to strike hands</hi>, i. e., <hi rend="ital">to close a contract as surety, to pledge one's person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12688.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12688.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fix, fasten; to turn intently</hi> in any direction: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est una altissimis defixa radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos in vultu regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratos oculos in te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus possessiones oculos defigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos defigere in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to let fall, cast down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas defixus lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos in ea, quae perspicua sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputare non vaganti oratione, sed defixa in una republica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo mentem orationemque defigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes suas curas in reip. salute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12688.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12688.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strike motionless</hi>, sc. with astonishment, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to stupefy, astound, astonish</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">utraque simul objecta res oculis animisque immobiles parumper eos defixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 40 al.</bibl>: silentium<cb n="DEFI" />  triste ita defixit omnium animos, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum stupet obtutuque haeret defixus in uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 495</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 156</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 5</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12688.8" n="2" level="3"> Religious t. t. * </sense><sense id="n12688.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To declare fixedly, firmly, unalterably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVAE AVGVR VITIOSA, DIRA DEFIXERIT, IRRITA SVNTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12688.10" n="b" level="4"> (Because, in making imprecations, the waxen image of him for whom destruction was to be prepared, or his name written in wax, was stuck through with a needle; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:91 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 91 sq.</bibl>, and Voss upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 80</bibl>.) <hi rend="ital">To bewitch, enchant; to curse</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">caput alicujus dira imprecatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defigi imprecationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina cerā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">DEFIXA NOMINA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis animum Iolchiacis votis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 376</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12688.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To censure, reprove</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:16" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defiguratus: <entryFree id="n12689" type="main" key="de_fi^gu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfĭgūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> In gramm., <sense id="n12689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">declined, derived</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 638</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
defingo: <entryFree id="n12690" type="main" key="de_fingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fingo</orth>, <itype>nxi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to form, to put in shape, to fashion</hi> (very rare; prob. belonging properly to the vulgar lang.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence in Hor., by way of sarcasm): panem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:74" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 74</bibl></cit> and 121.—Sarcast. of coarse poetic description: dum Defingit Rheni luteum caput, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
definienter: <entryFree id="n12691" type="main" key="de_fi_ni^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>definio</etym>, <sense id="n12691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnoscere, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Joan. Tr. 14, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
definio: <entryFree id="n12692" type="main" key="de_fi_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n12692.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bound, to set bounds to; to limit, terminate, define</hi> (for syn. v. decerno—freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n12692.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus fundi extremam partem oleae directo ordine definiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes caeli aspectum nostrum definiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem terrarum (loca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imperium populi R.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:67 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 31, 67 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n12692.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12692.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To designate by limiting; to limit, define, determine; to explain</hi> (cf. circumscribo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus universum brevi circumscribi et definiri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">universam et propriam oratoris vim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definienda res erit verbis et breviter describenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: omitto innumerabiles viros, etc.... unum hoc definio, tantam esse necessitatem virtutis, etc., <hi rend="ital">this only I declare</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: probe definitur a Stoicis <hi rend="ital">fortitudo</hi>, cum eam <hi rend="ital">virtutem esse</hi> dicunt <hi rend="ital">propugnantem pro aequitate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 27, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec uno modo definitur res eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes sibi optimas, hortos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suus cuique locus erat definitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 81, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus adeundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 83, 5</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quem diem iturus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum in annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem in quinquennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam vitam ingrediar, definias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non remittam: definitum est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is determined, decided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:20:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 20, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12692.4" n="2" level="3"> In opposition to breadth or laxity (cf. circumscribo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. 2), <hi rend="ital">to limit within certain bounds, to restrict, confine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vagabitur oratio mea longius atque eis fere ipsis definietur viris, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sententia definit amicitiam paribus officiis ac voluntatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 109</bibl>: ex perduellium numero definitus, <hi rend="ital">included in the definition of</hi>, Off. 3, 29, 107 (dub.). —</sense><sense id="n12692.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To terminate, finish</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. places): ut totam hujus generis orationem concludam atque definiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52</bibl></cit> Zumpt; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: definito juvene, <hi rend="ital">ended</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">slain</hi>, Apul. M. 8, p. 203, 20.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (according to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 1), <hi rend="ital">definite, limited, distinct, precise; plain, perspicuous</hi> (rare, but good prose): quaestionum duo sunt genera: alterum infinitum, alterum definitum. Definitum est, quod <foreign lang="greek">u(po/qesin</foreign> Graeci, nos causam, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. generales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum esse in caelo ac definitum locum, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with certus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 24</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fīnītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">definitely, precisely, distinctly</hi>, <pb n="531" /> <cb n="DEFL" /> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14</bibl>; de Or. 2, 27, 118; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:88:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 88, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:257 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 257 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
definitio: <entryFree id="n12693" type="main" key="de_fi_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>definio</etym>. * <sense id="n12693.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bounding, a boundary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">AREA INTRA HANC DEFINITIONEM CIPPORVM CLAVSA VERVBVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 736</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12693.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A limiting, prescribing, defining; a definition, explanation</hi> (freq. only in Cicero; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">definio): ut quodcumque accidisset praedictum videretur hominum et temporum definitione sublata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 54, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciorum aequorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">definitio</hi> est earum rerum, quae sunt ejus rei propriae, quam definire volumus, brevis et circumscripta quaedam explicatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 189</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 33, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitio pars sit translationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 42</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12693.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which is decreed, decided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetrata quippe est definitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 11, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
definitive: <entryFree id="n12694" type="main" key="de_fi_ni_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnītīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. foll. art. <sense id="n12694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
definitivus: <entryFree id="n12695" type="main" key="de_fi_ni_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnītīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>definio</etym>. <sense id="n12695.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Definitive, explanatory</hi>. So in the rhet. lang. of Cicero: constitutio, Inv. 2, 17; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> And in the later jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <trans><tr>a decisive, definitive sentence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 45, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 64, 10 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12695.1" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat. = definitus, <hi rend="ital">definite, distinct, plain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnītīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">definitively, plainly, distinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Car. Christ. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
definitor: <entryFree id="n12696" type="main" key="de_fi_ni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>definio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 1</etym>, <sense id="n12696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who determines, settles, appoints</hi>, (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
definitus: <entryFree id="n12697" type="main" key="de_fi_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of definio.</entryFree>
defio: <entryFree id="n12698" type="main" key="de_fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīo</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, v. deficio.</entryFree>
defioculus: <entryFree id="n12699" type="hapax" key="de_fi_o^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfīŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>humorously compounded from defit and oculus</etym>, <sense id="n12699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">who lacks an eye, one-eyed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:59:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 59, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defixio: <entryFree id="n12700" type="gloss" key="de_fixi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfixĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enchantment</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">nekromanti/ai, kata/desmoi</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr. [defigo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 2, b.].</sense></entryFree>
deflagratio: <entryFree id="n12701" type="main" key="de_fla_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflā^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deflagro</etym>, <sense id="n12701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning up, consuming by fire, conflagration</hi> (perhaps only in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n12701.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">futura aliquando caeli atque terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12701.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></sense></entryFree>
deflagro: <entryFree id="n12702" type="main" key="de_fla_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflā^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n12702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12702.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To burn down, to be consumed by fire</hi> (freq. only in Cic.; cf. conflagro). </sense><sense id="n12702.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12702.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua nocte natus esset Alexander, eadem Dianae Ephesiae templum deflagravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaëthon ictu fulminis deflagravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12702.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perish, be destroyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">communi incendio malint quam suo deflagrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:46:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 46, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruere ac deflagrare omnia passuri estis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12702.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (very rare): fana flammā deflagrata, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sol) proxime currendo deflagrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12702.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy utterly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cinere deflagrati imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit> (cf. deflagratio <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n12702.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To burn out, cease burning;</hi> rare, and only trop. of the fire of passion, = defervesco, <hi rend="ital">to abate, be allayed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deflagrare iras vestras posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deflagrante paullatim seditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram senis deflagrare pati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to persons: <cit><quote lang="la">sic deflagrare minaces Incassum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 280</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deflammo: <entryFree id="n12703" type="hapax" key="de_flammo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-flammo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to deprive of flame, to put out, extinguish</hi>: taedam, Ap. M. 5, p. 172, 26.</sense></entryFree>
deflecto: <entryFree id="n12704" type="main" key="de_flecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-flecto</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n12704.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to bend downwards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aside, to turn aside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in another direction</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12704.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">palmitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; Catull. 62, 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela (Venus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis in alium cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: cursum ad Romanos. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum ab aliqua re ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinam quolibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 789</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 337</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">novam viam,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn off, construct in another direction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12704.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12704.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 789</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos a cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DEFL" /> 76: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsos principes aliqua pravitas de via deflexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab institutis studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut declinet a proposito deflectatque sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad verba rem deflectere velimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam in senectute deflexit (for which, shortly before, mutavit), Cels. praef.: in ipsos factum deflectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios in suam utilitatem deflectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dotes puellae in pejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragoediam in obscenos risus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:409" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciosa consilia fortuna deflexit in melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:8:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes in vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se de curriculo petitionis,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mur. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12704.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp. (late Lat.), gramm. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to inflect, to vary the form of</hi> a word: <cit><quote lang="la">non solet sic deflecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Psa. 140, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12704.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to turn off, turn aside</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12704.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus militum deflectere viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">without via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 93 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tuscos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12704.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq., but almost exclusively in Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">deflexit jam aliquantulum de spatio curriculoque consuetudo majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de via (consuetudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de recta regione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a veritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio redeat illuc unde deflexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Domino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach 36, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defleo: <entryFree id="n12705" type="main" key="de_fle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-flĕo</orth>, <itype>ēvi, ētum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n12705.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12705.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To weep over</hi> a person or thing; <hi rend="ital">to lament, deplore, bewail</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deploro, ejulo, ploro, lacrimo, lamentor, fleo —class.): te cinefactum deflevimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:907" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 907</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptam (Eurydicen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nos impendentes casus deflevimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:329" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 329</bibl></cit>: illud initium civilis belli, Asinius Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eversionem civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassi mors a multis saepe defleta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:220 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 220 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in deflenda nece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit> et saep. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum assident, dum deflent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amici sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12705.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et minui deflevit onus dorsumque levari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 748</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12705.3" n="B" level="2"> Oculos, <hi rend="ital">to dull with weeping</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12705.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to weep much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violently, weep to exhaustion</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">gravibus cogor deflere querelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 13</bibl></cit>; Justin. 18, 4, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
defletio: <entryFree id="n12706" type="main" key="de_fle_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defleo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n12706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent weeping</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deflexie: <entryFree id="n12707" type="main" key="de_flexi^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflexĭe</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deflecto</etym>, <sense id="n12707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bending aside</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n12707.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa meatus solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12707.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: cupiditatum, Naz. Pan. Const. 5.</sense></entryFree>
deflexus: <entryFree id="n12708" type="main" key="de_flexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from deflecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12709" type="main" key="de_flexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deflecto</etym>, <sense id="n12709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending, turning aside</hi> (post-class.), in the trop. sense: <cit><quote lang="la">humani animi ab odio ad gratiam deflexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a virtute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 1, § 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deflo: <entryFree id="n12710" type="main" key="de_flo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-flo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n12710.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To blow off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12710.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To blow off, to cleanse by blowing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 27</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12710.2" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To blab</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 47, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defloccatus: <entryFree id="n12711" type="hapax" key="de_flocca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-floccātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>floccus</etym>, <sense id="n12711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shorn of locks, bald</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defloratio: <entryFree id="n12712" type="main" key="de_flo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defloro</etym>, <sense id="n12712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plucking of flowers</hi>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 12</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>a deflouring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defloreo: <entryFree id="n12713" type="main" key="de_flo_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflōrĕo</orth>,<itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n12713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to shed its blossoms</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitis pejus defloret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defloresco: <entryFree id="n12714" type="main" key="de_flo_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-flōresco</orth>, <itype>rui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to drop its blossoms; to fade, wither</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12714.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne frumentum ... deflorescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">praes.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 286</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (faba) defloruit, exiguas (aquas) desiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 120</bibl></cit>; so in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, Catull. 62, 43.—</sense><sense id="n12714.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fade, decay, decline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum corporibus vigere et deflorescere animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum senecta res quoque defloruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non talis, qualem tu eum jam deflorescentem cognovisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciae mature et celeriter deflorescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defloro: <entryFree id="n12715" type="main" key="de_flo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflōro</orth>, <itype>āre, āvi</itype> <etym>de-flos</etym>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit. <sense id="n12715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of flowers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> 1, 588</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12715.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgores solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deflorato virginitatis pudore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Jacob. 2, 7, 32</bibl></cit>. <cb n="DEFO" /></sense></entryFree>
defluo: <entryFree id="n12716" type="main" key="de_flu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n12716.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To flow down</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12716.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quod sanguen defluxerat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis a renibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 18, 105, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defluit lapidosus rivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:273" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma ex Aetna monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Fragm. 1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Fragm. 1, 116</bibl></cit>: flumen Lavida Tauro monte defluens, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 680</bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxis umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anaxum quo Varamus defluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potus defluit ad pulmonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12716.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things not liquid, <hi rend="ital">to move downwards softly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gradually; to glide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow down, descend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ipsae defluebant coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>.—Of clothing: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes vestis defluxit ad imos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga defluit male laxus,</quote> <trans><tr>hangs carelessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Sat. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—Of floating objects: <cit><quote lang="la">aries mersus secundo defluit amni,</quote> <trans><tr>floats, swims down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 447</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 495</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 549</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ostiam Tiberi,</quote> <trans><tr>to sail down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —Of riders: <cit><quote lang="la">tota cohors imitata relictis Ad terram defluxit equis,</quote> <trans><tr>dismounted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 501</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: in humum (ex equo), Furius poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, a dextro armo in latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12716.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flow, come, pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc totum e sophistarum fontibus defluxit in forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a necessariis artificiis ad elegantiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(adolescentes) tantum ab eo (sc. Seneca) defluebant, quantum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>departed, deviated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:126" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 126</bibl></cit> Frotsch., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus duplex Octaviorum familia defluxit,</quote> <trans><tr>are derived, descended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid in terram defluat,</quote> <trans><tr>be spilled on the ground, be lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaque merces tibi defluat aequo ab Jove,</quote> <trans><tr>flow to thee in abundance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 28, 28</bibl></cit> (cf. Theocr. 1, 5: <foreign lang="greek">*)/es te katar)r(ei=</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">a superis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:31:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 31, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid redundarit, ad illum defluxisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12716.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass away</hi> so as to disappear, <hi rend="ital">to cease flowing</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12716.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus exspectat dum defluat amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hiberni defluxere torrentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12716.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cease, vanish, pass away, disappear, be lost</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex novem tribunis unus defluxit,</quote> <trans><tr>has deserted, proved unfaithful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi salutatio defluxit,</quote> <trans><tr>has ceased, is over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi per socordiam vires, tempus, ingenium defluxere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenerae sucus Defluat praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 27, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 158</bibl>.—So of the falling out of the hair, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 56, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:231" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 39, 94, § 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 141</bibl></cit>.—In eccl. Lat. = defloresco: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 34, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defluus: <entryFree id="n12717" type="main" key="de_flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>defluo</etym>, <sense id="n12717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing down;</hi> or transf., <hi rend="ital">moving downwards, going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">falling down</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n12717.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:325" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 325</bibl></cit>: caesaries, <hi rend="ital">long and flowing</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 13, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:53" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12717.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">vasculum (in which a liquid runs down),</quote> <trans><tr>a water-clock</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defluvium: <entryFree id="n12718" type="main" key="de_flu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēflŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (perh. only in Plin.). <sense id="n12718.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A flowing down, flowing off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 281</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defluvia fontanea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12718.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A falling off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli, = alopecia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:108" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 34, § 108</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 230</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:34" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 13, 15, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defluxio: <entryFree id="n12719" type="main" key="de_fluxi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfluxĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing off, discharge</hi> (lat. Lat.): seminis, Firm. Math. 3, 7; ventris, Coel. Aur. Acut. 2, 18.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> = <foreign lang="greek">dia/r)r(oia</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">diarrhoea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defluxus: <entryFree id="n12720" type="hapax" key="de_fluxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfluxus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">running off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defodio: <entryFree id="n12721" type="main" key="de_fo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi, fossum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n12721.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To dig downwards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deep; to dig up, to dig</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">scrobem in limine stabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum in altitudinem pedum quinque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defosso lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n12721.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bury in the earth</hi> (quite class.): homines defoderunt in terram dimidiatos, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:935" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 935</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1366" default="NO" valid="yes">1366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesaurum defossum esse sub lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotem et novaculam in comitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitem (necatum) in aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem in agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:641 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 641 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:458" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 458</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12721.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hide</hi>, <pb n="532" /> <cb n="DEFO" /> <hi rend="ital">conceal, cover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defodiet (aetas) condetque nitentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae necessitas hominem defodit, ut erueret aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 5:15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 5, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
defoedo: <entryFree id="n12722" type="main" key="de_foedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-foedo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to defile</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">noli defoedare coronam meam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defomitatum: <entryFree id="n12723" type="gloss" key="de_fo_mi^ta_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfōmĭtātum</orth> <itype>a fomitibus succisum, quibus confoveri erat solitum lignum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75, 10</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
defore: <entryFree id="n12724" type="main" key="de_fo^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfŏre</orth>, v. desum.</entryFree>
deforis: <entryFree id="n12725" type="main" key="de_fo^ri_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfŏrīs</orth>, <sense id="n12725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., from outside, outside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusit eum Dominus deforis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod deforis est calicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 23, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 11, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deformaexta: <entryFree id="n12726" type="gloss" key="de_forma exta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēforma exta</orth>, = decocta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83, 11</bibl>.</entryFree>
