deformatio: <entryFree id="n12727" type="main" key="de_forma_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēformātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. deformo</etym>, <sense id="n12727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a representation, delineation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3</bibl>, praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12728" type="hapax" key="de_forma_ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēformātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. deformo</etym>, <sense id="n12728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deforming, disfiguring, defacing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae majestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 7, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deformis: <entryFree id="n12729" type="main" key="de_formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-formis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n12729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi>: deformīs dentibus, Apul. Met. 10, p. 249, 9), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forma; cf. 2. deformo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n12729.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Departing</hi>, either physically or (more freq.) morally, <hi rend="ital">from the right shape, quality</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">misshapen, deformed, unsightly, ugly, odious, disgusting; disgraceful, base</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">taeter, foedus, turpis—freq. and class.): longus an brevis, formosus an deformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformem esse natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calvitio quoque deformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, deformissima femina (opp. pulcherrima),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus non deforme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla deformior species est civitatis quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum patriae belli malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen (sc. inerme),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 24</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus (opp. species honesta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus statusve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio non tam honorifica audientibus quam sibi deformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanditiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haesitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium,</quote> <trans><tr>servile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 18</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deforme et servile est caedi discentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with a subject-clause,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 72</bibl></cit> (opp. foedissimum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 81</bibl> and 125; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; and in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 24</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">N. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformia meditari,</quote> <trans><tr>shameful deeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl></cit>.—* <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformis leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:166" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 166</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (post-Aug.): <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēformĭ-ter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n12729.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Misshapenly</hi>: formati, Apul. M. 8, p. 214, 4.—</sense><sense id="n12729.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Inelegantly; disgracefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonat junctura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicet multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: deformius errasse, Sulpic. Sev. Dial. 1, 6, 6. —* </sense><sense id="n12729.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Shapeless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 554</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deformitas: <entryFree id="n12730" type="main" key="de_formi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēformĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deformis, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</etym>, <sense id="n12730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deformity, ugliness</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n12730.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (physically): <cit><quote lang="la">quae si in deformitate corporis habet aliquid offensionis, quanta illa depravatio et foeditas animi debet videri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 239</bibl>; cf. of <hi rend="ital">mutilation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tanta deformitate,</quote> <trans><tr>hideousness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:12 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12730.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (morally), <hi rend="ital">baseness, vileness, deformity of character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an corporis pravitates habebunt aliquid offensionis, animi deformitas non habebit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:48" default="NO">8, 3, 48</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba meretricum vitia atque deformitates significantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12730.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An uncouth style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticitas et rigor et deformitas adferunt frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deformiter: <entryFree id="n12731" type="main" key="de_formi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēformĭter</orth>, <sense id="n12731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., inelegantly, disgracefully</hi>, etc.; v. deformis, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
deformo: <entryFree id="n12732" type="main" key="de_formo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-formo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bring into form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shape; to form, fashion; to design, delineate, describe</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n12732.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">areas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:161" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmora prima manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non flosculos sed certos ac deformatos fructus ostenderat,</quote> <trans><tr>full-formed, perfect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">9: tragicae (scenae) deformantur columnis et fastigiis et signis,</quote> <trans><tr>are delineated, represented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <cb n="DEFR" /> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">operis speciem exemplaribus pictis,</quote> <trans><tr>to represent in outline, to sketch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12732.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ita a fortuna deformata sunt, ut tamen a natura inchoata compareant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille, quem supra deformavi,</quote> <trans><tr>have depicted, described</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministratio deformata litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12733" type="main" key="de_formo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-formo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>forma; cf. deformis</etym>, <sense id="n12733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring out of shape; to deform, disfigure; to spoil, mar</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n12733.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformatus corpore, fractus animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumnis deformatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum macies deformat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:707" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos tonsura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 517</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem multo pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 844</bibl></cit> (for which, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 611</bibl>, turpare; and Catull. 64, 224; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 530</bibl>, foedare): <cit><quote lang="la">parietes nudos ac deformatos reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3</bibl>: patriam turpissimis incendiis et ruinis, Auct. B. Alex. 24, 3; cf. Italiam, Auct. (Cicero?) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12733.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to mar, disgrace, dishonor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae accusatores deformandi hujus causa dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(rusticana illa parsimonia) deformata atque ornamentis omnibus spoliata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem prava lectione (senatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam clade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa bona uno vitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem (with lacerare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 805</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deformus: <entryFree id="n12734" type="main" key="de_formus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēformus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. deformis <sense id="n12734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
defossus: <entryFree id="n12735" type="main" key="de_fossus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from defodio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12736" type="hapax" key="de_fossus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfossus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>defodio</etym>, <sense id="n12736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging deeply</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defraudatio: <entryFree id="n12737" type="hapax" key="de_frauda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfraudātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defraudo</etym>.— <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n12737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defrauding</hi>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deficiency</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defraudator: <entryFree id="n12738" type="hapax" key="de_frauda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfraudātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who defrauds, a defrauder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:65" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defraudatrix: <entryFree id="n12739" type="hapax" key="de_frauda_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfraudātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defraudator</etym>, <sense id="n12739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who defrauds</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defraudo: <entryFree id="n12740" type="main" key="de_fraudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fraudo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">defrūdo</orth> (cf. frustra and the compounds of claudo), āvi, ātum (old <sense id="n12740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> defraudassis = defraudaveris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 58</bibl>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to defraud, overreach, cheat</hi> (ante-class. and late; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. twice, in proverb. phrases only): tene ego defrudem?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 1, 1, 81 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 78</bibl> and 80; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me defrudes drachumā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 91</bibl></cit>; Apul. Met. 4, p. 154, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, p. 230, 13</bibl>: <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Mag. 82, p. 326, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 7, 23</bibl>.— Also with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">rei</hi>: aes defraudasse cauponem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 25, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and proverb.: quem ne andabatam quidem defraudare poteramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne brevitas defraudasse aures videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 66, 221</bibl></cit>: genium, <hi rend="ital">to deny one's self an enjoyment</hi> (opp. indulgere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 1, 10</bibl> Ruhnk.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nihil sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">two accus.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 19, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defremo: <entryFree id="n12741" type="main" key="de_fre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-frĕmo</orth>, <itype>ui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to ceaseraging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roaring, to abate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum primus ille impetus defremuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensim ira,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defrenatus: <entryFree id="n12742" type="hapax" key="de_fre_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-frēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>freno</etym>, <sense id="n12742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbridled, unrestrained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 282</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defrensa: <entryFree id="n12743" type="gloss" key="defrensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">defrensa</orth>, <itype>detrita atque detonsa</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 17</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
defricate: <entryFree id="n12744" type="main" key="de_fri^ca_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrĭcātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. defrico <sense id="n12744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
defricatio: <entryFree id="n12745" type="main" key="de_fri^ca_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrĭcātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defrico</etym>, <sense id="n12745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, Coel. Aur. Acut. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 2, 18; 19 al.</sense></entryFree>
defrico: <entryFree id="n12746" type="main" key="de_fri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-frĭco</orth>, <itype>cui, cātum and ctum</itype> (the former Catull. 37, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:70" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 188</bibl>; the latter in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:8" default="NO">7, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 10</bibl>), 1, <sense id="n12746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to rub off, rub down; to rub hard, to rub</hi> (rare; mostly technical; not in Cic. and Caes.). </sense><sense id="n12746.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: dentem, Catull. 37, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 216</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lichenes pumice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 10, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papulam saliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora pecudum quotidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces ceteraque membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 20</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vas aeneum defricabitur,</quote> <trans><tr>shall be scoured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: defricari, <hi rend="ital">mid., to rub one's self</hi>, as in a bath, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12746.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: urbem<cb n="DEFU" />  sale multo, <hi rend="ital">to lash well</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 4</bibl>.—Hence, *<orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrĭcātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <hi rend="ital">with biting sarcasm</hi>: facete et defricate, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 178</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
defrictus: <entryFree id="n12747" type="main" key="de_frictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from defrico.</entryFree>
defrigesco: <entryFree id="n12748" type="main" key="de_fri_gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-frīgesco</orth>, <itype>frixi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to cool off, grow cold</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">coctura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:1" default="NO">12, 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defringo: <entryFree id="n12749" type="main" key="de_fringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fringo</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to break off; to break to pieces</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n12749.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoram defracto collo puram impleto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:88" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 300</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum summā ab hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura aut cervices sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 126</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lumbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: caput ei testatim, Juventius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl> P.; cf.: caput ei hoc patibulo, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 366, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12749.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">id unum bonum est, quod numquam defringitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is never destroyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92</bibl></cit>; Apul. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3, p. 355:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, p. 355, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defrudo: <entryFree id="n12750" type="main" key="de_fru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrūdo</orth>, v. defraudo.</entryFree>
defrugo: <entryFree id="n12751" type="main" key="de_fru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-frūgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fruges</etym>, <sense id="n12751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rob of corn</hi>: segetem ne defruges, <hi rend="ital">to sow too little grain</hi>, Orac. Vet. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 55, § 200</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 5, 4</bibl> (Schneid. <hi rend="ital">defrudet</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
defruor: <entryFree id="n12752" type="hapax" key="de_fru^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-frŭor</orth>, <itype>frui</itype>, <sense id="n12752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to use up, consume by enjoying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumnitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:23" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">defrui</hi> dicebant antiqui ut <hi rend="ital">deamare, deperire</hi>, significantes omnem fructum percipere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=70:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 70, 14</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
defrusto: <entryFree id="n12753" type="main" key="de_frusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-frusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to divide into pieces, to dismember</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mesopotamiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 2 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
defrutarius: <entryFree id="n12754" type="main" key="de_fru^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrŭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>defrutum</etym>, <sense id="n12754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for</hi> defrutum (only in Col.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrutārium</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defruto: <entryFree id="n12755" type="main" key="de_fru^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrŭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil down into</hi> defrutum: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:24:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defrutum: <entryFree id="n12756" type="main" key="de_fru^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfrŭtum</orth>, <sense id="n12756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i, n.</hi> (perh. for defervitum, sc. mustum), <hi rend="ital">must boiled down</hi> (acc. to Varr. and Col., to one third; acc. to Plin., only to one half), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 551, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 269</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defuga: <entryFree id="n12757" type="main" key="de_fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>defugio</etym>, <sense id="n12757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a runaway, deserter</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 12, 19, 3</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 42.</sense></entryFree>
defugio: <entryFree id="n12758" type="main" key="de_fu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n12758.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12758.1" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">acc., to run away from; to flee, shun, avoid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiendo devitare (class.): aditum alicujus sermonemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:82:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19, 34</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias fortunae defugiendo relinquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam disputationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentiones, inimicitias, vitae dimicationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw from responsibility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n12758.2" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen defugio quin dicam quae scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12758.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., to shun, avoid, escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam suscipiant: sin timore defugiant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12758.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Intrans., to escape by flight, run away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa ripam Tiberis, quo sinistrum cornu defugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defugo: <entryFree id="n12759" type="hapax" key="de_fu^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fŭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to drive away, remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defulguro: <entryFree id="n12760" type="hapax" key="de_fulgu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fulgŭro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to flash forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeus ignem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Iliad. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defunctio: <entryFree id="n12761" type="main" key="de_functi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defungor</etym> (eccl. Lat.). <sense id="n12761.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Execution, performance</hi>: cordis, Salvian. Gub. Dei, p. 28.—</sense><sense id="n12761.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Death</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defunctorius: <entryFree id="n12762" type="main" key="de_functo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfunctōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>defungor</etym>, <sense id="n12762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quickly despatched; slight, cursory</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">for class. negligens, levis): apodixis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 136, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfunctōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slightly, cursorily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:17:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defunctus: <entryFree id="n12763" type="main" key="de_functus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from defungor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12764" type="main" key="de_functus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfunctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>defungor</etym>, <sense id="n12764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">death</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Velent. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defundo: <entryFree id="n12765" type="main" key="de_fundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to pour</hi> <pb n="533" /> <cb n="DEGE" /> <hi rend="ital">down, pour out</hi> (in the ante-Aug. per. very rare; not in Cic. and Caes.). </sense><sense id="n12765.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:156:5" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 156, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum (sc. ex dolio in amphoram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">late sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:453" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 453</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ovi album in vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in fictilia labra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:10 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 10 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges pleno cornu,</quote> <trans><tr>pours forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voces pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 121, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12765.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., a religious t. t., <hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi>, as a libation: <cit><quote lang="la">te prosequitur mero Defuso pateris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">libamenta Mercurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
defungor: <entryFree id="n12766" type="main" key="de_fungor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fungor</orth>, <itype>functus</itype> (<sense id="n12766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">infin. pass. parag.</hi> defungier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 32</bibl>), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. dep., to have done with, to acquit one's self of, to discharge</hi> an affair or an obligation (esp. an unwelcome, unpleasant one), <hi rend="ital">to perform, finish</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n12766.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:963" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 963</bibl></cit>: tam vili munere orationis, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni populari concitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus decumis pro una,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: hoc mendacio, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis fato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fatalibus malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimorum morbis, perpaucis funeribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 24, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:541" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 541</bibl> et saep.; esp. of the finishing of this (troublesome) life (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vitā,</quote> <trans><tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 475</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 306</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis temporibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but, sua morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:25:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:7:5" default="NO">8, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 254</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">defunctum bello barbiton,</quote> <trans><tr>discharged from the warfare of love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12766.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec adversus illos mercede defungor,</quote> <trans><tr>nor do I discharge my obligation by the payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: defunctus jam sum, <hi rend="ital">now I am quit</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">safe, out of danger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 15</bibl> Ruhnk.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 9, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">To depart, die</hi> (not ante Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra): dicitur prius esse defunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, defunctus, = mortuus,</quote> <trans><tr>deceased, defunct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:15" default="NO">5, 14, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Matth. 9</bibl>. 18.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <itype>defuncti</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dead</hi>, Sen. ad. Marc. 13, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Polyb. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 63, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:175 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 68, 68, § 175 al.</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
defusio: <entryFree id="n12767" type="main" key="de_fu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēfūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defundo</etym>, <sense id="n12767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pouring out</hi> into vessels, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
defututus: <entryFree id="n12768" type="hapax" key="de_fu^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-fŭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>futuo</etym>, <sense id="n12768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exhausted by sensuality</hi>: puella, Catull. 41, 1.</sense></entryFree>
degener: <entryFree id="n12769" type="main" key="de_ge^ner"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-gĕner</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> degeneri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 19</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>genus</etym>, <sense id="n12769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that departs from its race</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kind, degenerate, not genuine</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; esp. freq. in Plin. and Tac.; not in Quint. and Suet.). </sense><sense id="n12769.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neoptolemum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 549</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 693</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitate formae haud degener,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi (Galli) jam degeneres sunt, mixti, et Gallograeci vere, quod appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 49, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum degeneres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 50, 111, § 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12769.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrii non degener oris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:619" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altae virtutis patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:68" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12769.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mentally</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morally degenerate, ignoble, base</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Muttinem sibi modum facere, degenerem Afrum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 40, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Artabanum materna origine Arsacidem, cetera degenerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā non degener,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non degener ad pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">degeneres animos timor arguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">questus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:164" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">projectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of language: <cit><quote lang="la">bilingues, paulatim a domestico externo sermone degeneres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga (for togati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 365</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> ( = indignus): <cit><quote lang="la">degener haud Gracchis consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:5:17" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantoduce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Jacob. 2, 11, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
degenero: <entryFree id="n12770" type="main" key="de_ge^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēgĕnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n12770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [degener]. </sense><sense id="n12770.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to depart from its race</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kind, to degenerate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n12770.2" n="A" level="2"> <cb n="DEGO" /> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a vobis nihil degenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandione nata, degeneras!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomaque degenerant succos oblita priores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum in avenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 15, 25, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedones in Syros degenerarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12770.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12770.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac virtute majorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">a gravitate paterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a parentibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a familia imperiosissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a civili more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fama vitaque sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo a libertate sed etiam a servitute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Stoicis degeneravit Panaetius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12770.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:148" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12770.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">degenerant nati patribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 78</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Marti paterno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:464" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Honor. 366</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12770.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad theatrales artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in feritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 15, 25, § 117</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo eum et disciplina degenerare non sineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Narisci Quadive degenerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 68</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12770.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12770.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to degenerate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deteriorate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus carpit corpus et vires animosque degenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum degenerat transcribentium fors varia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni degeneratum in aliis huic quoque decori offecisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his degeneracy, his vicious character</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>; see Zumpt, Gram. § 638, N. 1.—</sense><sense id="n12770.10" n="B" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> of that from which any thing degenerates, <hi rend="ital">to dishonor, to stain</hi>, by degeneracy (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">non degenerasse propinquos (sc. me),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:81" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 81</bibl></cit> (5, 1, 79 M): <cit><quote lang="la">palmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:149" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Silv. 3, 1, 160</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectus degenerati patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 17, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
degero: <entryFree id="n12771" type="main" key="de_ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-gĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to carry away, carry off</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">de vinea sarmenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:37:5" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 37, 5</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea ornamenta ad meretrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum meum tuae amicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 41</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 27, 60, § 131</bibl>, the true reading is digeritur).</sense></entryFree>
deglabro: <entryFree id="n12772" type="main" key="de_gla_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-glā^bro</orth>, no <sense id="n12772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to smooth off, make smooth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:7:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deglubo: <entryFree id="n12773" type="main" key="de_glu_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-glūbo</orth>, no <sense id="n12773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ptum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to peel off; to shell, to husk</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n12773.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">granum eo folliculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12773.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12773.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take off the skin; to skin, flay</hi> (rare): se vel vivum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 158, 22</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">maenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: pecus, Tiber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: murem, Marc. Empir. 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—* </sense><sense id="n12773.4" n="B" level="2"> In an obscene sense, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 71, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deglutino: <entryFree id="n12774" type="hapax" key="de_glu_ti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-glūtĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to unglue, to separate by moistening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 103, § 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
degluttio: <entryFree id="n12775" type="main" key="de_glutti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-gluttĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">deglūtĭo</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n12775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to swallow down</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): hunc cibum, Fronto Ep. ad amic. 1, 15: virum, Avit. 4, 364; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,041:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jon. 2, 1</bibl>; Psa. 124, 3. Said of the earth, Num. 16, 30.—</sense><sense id="n12775.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overwhelm, abolish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 23.</sense></entryFree>
dego: <entryFree id="n12776" type="main" key="de_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēgo</orth>, <itype>dēgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>de-ago</etym>, <sense id="n12776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spend, pass</hi>, sc. time (for syn. cf.: ago, gero, facio—very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12776.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mane ad noctem usque in foro dego diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">diem in laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:118 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 118 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne tempus aetatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1094" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1094</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:173" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 173</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cic. Fragm. ap. Augustin. Trin. 4, 2: vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 313</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:551 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 551 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquum est vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectam turpem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 31, 20</bibl></cit>: otia pacato in thalamo, Catull. 68, 104 al.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantis periclis degitur hoc aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1178</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12776.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., to live</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">laetus deget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 29, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes sic degunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 12</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: certus procul urbe degere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine nequitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 25, 29, § 112</bibl>: vita humanior sine sale non quit degere, to <hi rend="ital">continue, endure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 41</bibl>, <cb n="DEHA" /> § 88.—</sense><sense id="n12776.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry on, wage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautae contractum cum ventis degere bellum (cf.: agere, peragere bellum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:968" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 968</bibl></cit>.!*? "DEGERE antiqui posuerunt pro <hi rend="ital">exspectare</hi>," Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:73:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 73, 4</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
degrandinat: <entryFree id="n12777" type="hapax" key="de_grandi^nat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-grandĭnat</orth>, <sense id="n12777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers., it hails violently, continues to hail</hi>, or (as others interpret) <hi rend="ital">ceases to hail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:755" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 755</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
degrassor: <entryFree id="n12778" type="main" key="de_grassor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-grassor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n12778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n12778.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to rush down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorsum degrassantur aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 94</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12778.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">to attack fiercely, to revile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primos duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:406" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 406</bibl></cit> (cf. grassor with the <case>acc.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Theb. 8, 5, 4</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
degravo: <entryFree id="n12779" type="main" key="de_gra^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-grăvo</orth>, no <sense id="n12779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to weigh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">press down, to overpower</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n12779.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">unda caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7:58" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7, 58</bibl></cit> (4, 6, 58 M.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altam ulmum (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partīs navigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumventum cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora ingenti passu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:777 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 777 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverum mole degravante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12779.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drag down, burden, incommode</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritos nandi lassitudo et vulnera et pavor degravant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec gremium, laxos degravat illa sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:436" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 1</bibl></cit>. Cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus degravabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
degredior: <entryFree id="n12780" type="main" key="de_gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>gradior</etym>, <sense id="n12780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go down, march down, descend</hi> (never, to go away, depart, like digredior— <cit><quote lang="la">freq. only after the Aug. period, esp. in Liv. and Tac.): de via in semitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 40</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">degressus ex arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 66</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 67</bibl></cit> al.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">degrediente eo magnā prosequentium multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in specum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aequum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>to alight, dismount</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 2</bibl>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl>, the true reading is digredi.)</sense></entryFree>
degrumor: <entryFree id="n12781" type="main" key="de_gru_mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-grūmor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n12781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [gruma], <hi rend="ital">to level off, to straighten</hi> (only in the foll. passages): viam, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 63, 9</bibl>: ferrum, Enn. ib.</sense></entryFree>
